chapters.name: Stotra (The Hymn of 1000 Names)
chapters.summary: The main devotional hymn containing the 1,000 epithets of Lalita Tripurasundari, as narrated by Hayagrīva. The names detail her divine form, actions, abode, and cosmic powers, forming the central core of her worship (Arcana). This section is traditionally followed by the Phalaśruti (results of recitation).

verses.original:
अरुणां करुणा-तरङ्गिताक्षीं धृत-पाशाङ्कुश-पुष्प-बाण-चापाम्।
अणिमादिभिर्-आवृतां मयूखैर्-अहम् इत्येव विभावये भवानीम्॥
verses.transliteration:
aruṇāṁ karuṇā-taraṅgitākṣīṁ dhṛta-pāśāṅkuśa-puṣpa-bāṇa-cāpām।
aṇimādibhir-āvṛtāṁ mayūkhair-aham ityeva vibhāvaye bhavānīm॥

translations.english: I meditate on Bhavānī, who is rosy red, whose eyes are full of waves of compassion, who holds the noose, goad, flower arrows, and bow. She is surrounded by the Aṇimā and other powers (Siddhis), and I meditate on Her as 'I Am'.

verses.original:
ॐ श्रीमाता श्रीमहाराज्ञी श्रीमत्-सिंहासनेश्वरी ।
चिदग्नि-कुण्ड-सम्भूता देवकार्य-समुद्यता ॥ १॥
verses.transliteration:
oṃ śrīmātā śrīmahārājñī śrīmat-siṃhāsaneśvarī .
cidagni-kuṇḍa-sambhūtā devakārya-samudyatā .. 1..

translations.english: Oṁ. The Sacred Mother, the Great Empress, the Sovereign of the glorious Lion Throne. She who was born from the fire-pit of Consciousness, and is ready to accomplish the mission of the Devas.

verses.original:
उद्यद्भानु-सहस्राभा चतुर्बाहु-समन्विता ।
रागस्वरूप-पाशाढ्या क्रोधाकाराङ्कुशोज्ज्वला ॥ २॥
verses.transliteration:
udyadbhānu-sahasrābhā caturbāhu-samanvitā .
rāgasvarūpa-pāśāḍhyā krodhākārāṅkuśojjvalā .. 2..

translations.english: Shining like a thousand rising suns, possessing four arms. She holds the noose that is the essence of Desire (Rāga), and brilliantly holds the goad that is the form of Anger (Krodha).

verses.original:
मनोरूपेक्षु-कोदण्डा पञ्चतन्मात्र-सायका ।
निजारुण-प्रभापूर-मज्जद्ब्रह्माण्ड-मण्डला ॥ ३॥
verses.transliteration:
manorūpekṣu-kodaṇḍā pañcatanmātra-sāyakā .
nijāruṇa-prabhāpūra-majjadbrahmāṇḍa-maṇḍalā .. 3..

translations.english: Holding the sugar-cane bow (the mind) and five subtle elements (Tanmātrās) as Her arrows. The entire universe is immersed in the flood of Her own crimson radiance.

verses.original:
चम्पकाशोक-पुन्नाग-सौगन्धिक-लसत्कचा ।
कुरुविन्दमणि-श्रेणी-कनत्कोटीर-मण्डिता ॥ ४॥
verses.transliteration:
campakāśoka-punnāga-saugandhika-lasatkacā .
kuruvindamaṇi-śreṇī-kanatkoṭīra-maṇḍitā .. 4..

translations.english: Her beautiful hair is fragrant with Champaka, Aśoka, Punnāga, and Saugandhika flowers. Her crown is adorned with glittering rows of Kuruvinda (Padmarāga) jewels.

verses.original:
अष्टमीचन्द्र-विभ्राज-दलिकस्थल-शोभिता ।
मुखचन्द्र-कलङ्काभ-मृगनाभि-विशेषका ॥ ५॥
verses.transliteration:
aṣṭamīcandra-vibhrāja-dalikasthala-śobhitā .
mukhacandra-kalaṅkābha-mṛganābhi-viśeṣakā .. 5..

translations.english: Her forehead shines like the moon of the eighth day. Her musk Tilaka mark on the forehead resembles the dark spot (Kalaṅka) on the moon that is Her face.

verses.original:
वदनस्मर-माङ्गल्य-गृहतोरण-चिल्लिका ।
वक्त्रलक्ष्मी-परीवाह-चलन्मीनाभ-लोचना ॥ ६॥
verses.transliteration:
vadanasmara-māṅgalya-gṛhatoraṇa-cillikā .
vaktralakṣmī-parīvāha-calanmīnābha-locanā .. 6..

translations.english: Her eyebrows are like the festive archways (Toraṇas) at the entrance of the house of Kāma (Love). Her eyes, which resemble moving fish, are like the overflow of the beauty of Her face.

verses.original:
नवचम्पक-पुष्पाभ-नासादण्ड-विराजिता ।
ताराकान्ति-तिरस्कारि-नासाभरण-भासुरा ॥ ७॥
verses.transliteration:
navacampaka-puṣpābha-nāsādaṇḍa-virājitā .
tārākānti-tiraskāri-nāsābharaṇa-bhāsurā .. 7..

translations.english: Her nose is beautiful like a freshly bloomed Champaka flower. Her nose ornament shines so brightly that it surpasses the lustre of the stars.

verses.original:
कदम्बमञ्जरी-कॢप्त-कर्णपूर-मनोहरा ।
ताटङ्क-युगली-भूत-तपनोडुप-मण्डला ॥ ८॥
verses.transliteration:
kadambamañjarī-kḷpta-karṇapūra-manoharā .
tāṭaṅka-yugalī-bhūta-tapanoḍupa-maṇḍalā .. 8..

translations.english: She is captivating with ear ornaments made of Kadamba blossoms. Her pair of ear-rings (Tāṭaṅkas) transform into the circles of the Sun and Moon.

verses.original:
पद्मराग-शिलादर्श-परिभावि-कपोलभूः ।
नवविद्रुम-बिम्बश्री-न्यक्कारि-रदनच्छदा ॥ ९॥
verses.transliteration:
padmarāga-śilādarśa-paribhāvi-kapolabhūḥ .
navavidruma-bimbaśrī-nyakkāri-radanacchadā .. 9..

translations.english: Her cheeks put to shame the clarity of a Padmarāga gem mirror. Her lips surpass the beauty of a fresh coral or the Bimba fruit.

verses.original:
शुद्ध-विद्याङ्कुराकार-द्विजपङ्क्ति-द्वयोज्ज्वला ।
कर्पूर-वीटिकामोद-समाकर्षि-दिगन्तरा ॥ १०॥
verses.transliteration:
śuddha-vidyāṅkurākāra-dvijapaṅkti-dvayojjvalā .
karpūra-vīṭikāmoda-samākarṣi-digantarā .. 10..

translations.english: Her two rows of shining teeth are like the sprouts of pure knowledge (Śuddha Vidyā). The fragrance of the betel-roll (Vīṭikā) she chews spreads and attracts all corners of the world.

verses.original:
निज-सल्लाप-माधुर्य-विनिर्भर्त्सित-कच्छपी ।
मन्दस्मित-प्रभापूर-मज्जत्कामेश-मानसा ॥ ११॥
verses.transliteration:
nija-sallāpa-mādhurya-vinirbhartsita-kacchapī .
mandasmita-prabhāpūra-majjatkāmeśa-mānasā .. 11..

translations.english: The sweetness of Her own conversation shames the Vīṇā (Kacchapī) of Sarasvatī. The mind of Kāmeśvara (Śiva) is immersed in the flood of light from Her gentle smile.

verses.original:
अनाकलित-सादृश्य-चिबुकश्री-विराजिता ।
कामेश-बद्ध-माङ्गल्य-सूत्र-शोभित-कन्धरा ॥ १२॥
verses.transliteration:
anākalita-sādṛśya-cibukaśrī-virājitā .
kāmeśa-baddha-māṅgalya-sūtra-śobhita-kandharā .. 12..

translations.english: She shines with a chin whose beauty is incomparable. Her neck is adorned with the auspicious thread (Māṅgalya Sūtra) tied by Kāmeśvara.

verses.original:
कनकाङ्गद-केयूर-कमनीय-भुजान्विता ।
रत्नग्रैवेय-चिन्ताक-लोल-मुक्ता-फलान्विता ॥ १३॥
verses.transliteration:
kanakāṅgada-keyūra-kamanīya-bhujānvitā .
ratnagraiveya-cintāka-lola-muktā-phalānvitā .. 13..

translations.english: Her charming arms are adorned with golden bracelets (Aṅgadas) and armlets (Keyūras). She wears a jewel necklace (Graiveya) with a pendant that has swaying pearls (Cintāka).

verses.original:
कामेश्वर-प्रेमरत्न-मणि-प्रतिपण-स्तनी ।
नाभ्यालवाल-रोमालि-लता-फल-कुचद्वयी ॥ १४॥
verses.transliteration:
kāmeśvara-premaratna-maṇi-pratipaṇa-stanī .
nābhyālavāla-romāli-latā-phala-kucadvayī .. 14..

translations.english: Her breasts are like jewels exchanged for the jewel of Kāmeśvara's love. Her two breasts are like the fruits on the creeper of fine hair (Romāli) rising from the basin (Ālavāla) of Her navel.

verses.original:
लक्ष्यरोम-लताधारता-समुन्नेय-मध्यमा ।
स्तनभार-दलन्मध्य-पट्टबन्ध-वलित्रया ॥ १५॥
verses.transliteration:
lakṣyaroma-latādhāratā-samunneya-madhyamā .
stanabhāra-dalanmadhya-paṭṭabandha-valitrayā .. 15..

translations.english: Her waist is so slender that its existence is inferred only by its support of the fine hair-creeper. Her waist is adorned with three folds (Valis) that appear like a supporting belt (Paṭṭabandha) against the heavy weight of Her breasts.

verses.original:
अरुणारुण-कौसुम्भ-वस्त्र-भास्वत्-कटीतटी ।
रत्न-किङ्किणिका-रम्य-रशना-दाम-भूषिता ॥ १६॥
verses.transliteration:
aruṇāruṇa-kausumbha-vastra-bhāsvat-kaṭītaṭī .
ratna-kiṅkiṇikā-ramya-raśanā-dāma-bhūṣitā .. 16..

translations.english: Her hips shine with a deep reddish-crimson silk garment. She is adorned with a girdle (Raśanā-dāma) beautiful with small jewel-bells (Kiṅkiṇikā).

verses.original:
कामेश-ज्ञात-सौभाग्य-मार्दवोरु-द्वयान्विता ।
माणिक्य-मुकुटाकार-जानुद्वय-विराजिता ॥ १७॥
verses.transliteration:
kāmeśa-jñāta-saubhāgya-mārdavoru-dvayānvitā .
māṇikya-mukuṭākāra-jānudvaya-virājitā .. 17..

translations.english: She possesses two thighs whose fortunate softness is known only to Kāmeśa. Her two knees shine like ruby crowns.

verses.original:
इन्द्रगोप-परिक्षिप्त-स्मरतूणाभ-जङ्घिका ।
गूढगुल्फा कूर्मपृष्ठ-जयिष्णु-प्रपदान्विता ॥ १८॥
verses.transliteration:
indragopa-parikṣipta-smaratūṇābha-jaṅghikā .
gūḍhagulphā kūrmapṛṣṭha-jayiṣṇu-prapadānvitā .. 18..

translations.english: Her shanks resemble Kāma's quiver, covered with Indragopa (cochineal insects, suggesting a beautiful red color). Her ankles are concealed (beautifully smooth), and Her forefeet surpass the curve of a tortoise's back.

verses.original:
नख-दीधिति-संछन्न-नमज्जन-तमोगुणा ।
पदद्वय-प्रभाजाल-पराकृत-सरोरुहा ॥ १९॥
verses.transliteration:
nakha-dīdhiti-saṃchanna-namajjana-tamoguṇā .
padadvaya-prabhājāla-parākṛta-saroruhā .. 19..

translations.english: The darkness (of ignorance) of Her bowing devotees is dispelled by the radiance of Her toenails. The cluster of light from Her two feet defeats the beauty of a lotus.

verses.original:
सिञ्जान-मणिमञ्जीर-मण्डित-श्री-पदाम्बुजा ।
मराली-मन्दगमना महालावण्य-शेवधिः ॥ २०॥
verses.transliteration:
siñjāna-maṇimañjīra-maṇḍita-śrī-padāmbujā .
marālī-mandagamanā mahālāvaṇya-śevadhiḥ .. 20..

translations.english: Her sacred lotus-feet are adorned with jingling, jeweled anklets (Mañjīras). She walks slowly and gracefully like a swan (Marālī), and is a great treasury of beauty.

verses.original:
सर्वारुणाऽनवद्याङ्गी सर्वाभरण-भूषिता ।
शिव-कामेश्वराङ्कस्था शिवा स्वाधीन-वल्लभा ॥ २१॥
verses.transliteration:
sarvāruṇā’navadyāṅgī sarvābharaṇa-bhūṣitā .
śiva-kāmeśvarāṅkasthā śivā svādhīna-vallabhā .. 21..

translations.english: She is entirely crimson (Sarvāruṇā), with flawless limbs, adorned with all ornaments. She is seated on the lap of Śiva-Kāmeśvara, is auspicious (Śivā), and Her husband is under Her control.

verses.original:
सुमेरु-मध्य-श‍ृङ्गस्था श्रीमन्नगर-नायिका ।
चिन्तामणि-गृहान्तस्था पञ्च-ब्रह्मासन-स्थिता ॥ २२॥
verses.transliteration:
sumeru-madhya-śṛṅgasthā śrīmannagara-nāyikā .
cintāmaṇi-gṛhāntasthā pañca-brahmāsana-sthitā .. 22..

translations.english: Residing on the central peak of Mount Sumeru, She is the Queen of the glorious Śrī Nagara. Dwelling inside the house of the Wishing-Gem (Cintāmaṇi), She is seated on the throne of the five Brahmās (Pañca-Brahmāsana).

verses.original:
महापद्माटवी-संस्था कदम्बवन-वासिनी ।
सुधासागर-मध्यस्था कामाक्षी कामदायिनी ॥ २३॥
verses.transliteration:
mahāpadmāṭavī-saṃsthā kadambavana-vāsinī .
sudhāsāgara-madhyasthā kāmākṣī kāmadāyinī .. 23..

translations.english: She is established in the great forest of lotuses, residing in the Kadamba forest. Dwelling in the middle of the ocean of nectar, She is the Kāmākṣī (one whose glance fulfills desires) and the granter of desires.

verses.original:
देवर्षि-गण-संघात-स्तूयमानात्म-वैभवा ।
भण्डासुर-वधोद्युक्त-शक्तिसेना-समन्विता ॥ २४॥
verses.transliteration:
devarṣi-gaṇa-saṃghāta-stūyamānātma-vaibhavā .
bhaṇḍāsura-vadhodyukta-śaktisenā-samanvitā .. 24..

translations.english: Her glory is praised by the assemblies of Devas and sages. She is surrounded by the army of Śaktis (Goddesses) ready for the slaying of the demon Bhaṇḍāsura.

verses.original:
सम्पत्करी-समारूढ-सिन्धुर-व्रज-सेविता ।
अश्वारूढाधिष्ठिताश्व-कोटि-कोटिभिरावृता ॥ २५॥
verses.transliteration:
sampatkarī-samārūḍha-sindhura-vraja-sevitā .
aśvārūḍhādhiṣṭhitāśva-koṭi-koṭibhirāvṛtā .. 25..

translations.english: She is served by a host of elephants mounted by Sampatkarī (Her commander). She is surrounded by millions and millions of horses mounted by Aśvārūḍhā (another commander).

verses.original:
चक्रराज-रथारूढ-सर्वायुध-परिष्कृता ।
गेयचक्र-रथारूढ-मन्त्रिणी-परिसेविता ॥ २६॥
verses.transliteration:
cakrarāja-rathārūḍha-sarvāyudha-pariṣkṛtā .
geyacakra-rathārūḍha-mantriṇī-parisevitā .. 26..

translations.english: She is mounted on the Cakrarāja chariot, adorned with all weapons. She is attended by Mantriṇī (Śyāmalā), who is mounted on the Geyacakra chariot.

verses.original:
किरिचक्र-रथारूढ-दण्डनाथा-पुरस्कृता ।
ज्वाला-मालिनिकाक्षिप्त-वह्निप्राकार-मध्यगा ॥ २७॥
verses.transliteration:
kiricakra-rathārūḍha-daṇḍanāthā-puraskṛtā .
jvālā-mālinikākṣipta-vahniprākāra-madhyagā .. 27..

translations.english: She is preceded by Daṇḍanāthā (Vārāhī), who is mounted on the Kiricakra chariot. She is inside the wall of fire created by Jvālā-Mālinikā.

verses.original:
भण्डसैन्य-वधोद्युक्त-शक्ति-विक्रम-हर्षिता ।
नित्या-पराक्रमाटोप-निरीक्षण-समुत्सुका ॥ २८॥
verses.transliteration:
bhaṇḍasainya-vadhodyukta-śakti-vikrama-harṣitā .
nityā-parākramāṭopa-nirīkṣaṇa-samutsukā .. 28..

translations.english: She is delighted by the valor of the Śaktis engaged in the destruction of Bhaṇḍa's army. She is eagerly watching the fierce display of prowess by the Nityā deities.

verses.original:
भण्डपुत्र-वधोद्युक्त-बाला-विक्रम-नन्दिता ।
मन्त्रिण्यम्बा-विरचित-विषङ्ग-वध-तोषिता ॥ २९॥
verses.transliteration:
bhaṇḍaputra-vadhodyukta-bālā-vikrama-nanditā .
mantriṇyambā-viracita-viṣaṅga-vadha-toṣitā .. 29..

translations.english: She rejoices in the valor of Bālā (Bālā Tripurasundarī), who is intent on slaying Bhaṇḍa's sons. She is pleased by the slaying of Viṣaṅga accomplished by Mother Mantriṇī.

verses.original:
विशुक्र-प्राणहरण-वाराही-वीर्य-नन्दिता ।
कामेश्वर-मुखालोक-कल्पित-श्रीगणेश्वरा ॥ ३०॥
verses.transliteration:
viśukra-prāṇaharaṇa-vārāhī-vīrya-nanditā .
kāmeśvara-mukhāloka-kalpita-śrīgaṇeśvarā .. 30..

translations.english: She is pleased by the prowess of Vārāhī, who took the life of Viśukra. She created Śrī Gaṇeśvara (Gaṇapati) from the mere glance at the face of Kāmeśvara.

verses.original:
महागणेश-निर्भिन्न-विघ्नयन्त्र-प्रहर्षिता ।
भण्डासुरेन्द्र-निर्मुक्त-शस्त्र-प्रत्यस्त्र-वर्षिणी ॥ ३१॥
verses.transliteration:
mahāgaṇeśa-nirbhinna-vighnayantra-praharṣitā .
bhaṇḍāsurendra-nirmukta-śastra-pratyastra-varṣiṇī .. 31..

translations.english: She is greatly delighted by Mahāgaṇeśa's destruction of the Vighnayantra (obstacle-creating machine). She showers counter-weapons (Pratyastras) against the weapons released by Bhaṇḍāsura.

verses.original:
कराङ्गुलि-नखोत्पन्न-नारायण-दशाकृतिः ।
महा-पाशुपतास्त्राग्नि-निर्दग्धासुर-सैनिका ॥ ३२॥
verses.transliteration:
karāṅguli-nakhotpanna-nārāyaṇa-daśākṛtiḥ .
mahā-pāśupatāstrāgni-nirdagdhāsura-sainikā .. 32..

translations.english: From the nail of Her finger, the ten forms of Nārāyaṇa (Daśāvatāras) were manifested. She burned the army of demons to ashes with the fire of the Mahāpāśupata missile.

verses.original:
कामेश्वरास्त्र-निर्दग्ध-सभण्डासुर-शून्यका ।
ब्रह्मोपेन्द्र-महेन्द्रादि-देव-संस्तुत-वैभवा ॥ ३३॥
verses.transliteration:
kāmeśvarāstra-nirdagdha-sabhaṇḍāsura-śūnyakā .
brahmopendra-mahendrādi-deva-saṃstuta-vaibhavā .. 33..

translations.english: She reduced Bhaṇḍāsura and his world to nothingness with the Kāmeśvarāstra (weapon of Kāmeśvara). Her glory is praised by Brahmā, Upendra (Viṣṇu), Mahendra (Indra), and other Devas.

verses.original:
हर-नेत्राग्नि-संदग्ध-काम-सञ्जीवनौषधिः ।
श्रीमद्वाग्भव-कूटैक-स्वरूप-मुख-पङ्कजा ॥ ३४॥
verses.transliteration:
hara-netrāgni-saṃdagdha-kāma-sañjīvanauṣadhiḥ .
śrīmadvāgbhava-kūṭaika-svarūpa-mukha-paṅkajā .. 34..

translations.english: She is the life-giving medicine (Sañjīvana Auṣadhi) for Kāma (Cupid), who was burnt by the fire from Hara's (Śiva's) third eye. Her lotus-face is the form of the glorious Vāgbhava Kūṭa (the first part of the Pāñcadaśākṣarī Mantra).

verses.original:
कण्ठाधः-कटि-पर्यन्त-मध्यकूट-स्वरूपिणी ।
शक्ति-कूटैकतापन्न-कट्यधोभाग-धारिणी ॥ ३५॥
verses.transliteration:
kaṇṭhādhaḥ-kaṭi-paryanta-madhyakūṭa-svarūpiṇī .
śakti-kūṭaikatāpanna-kaṭyadhobhāga-dhāriṇī .. 35..

translations.english: The region from Her neck to Her waist is the form of the Middle Kūṭa. The region below Her waist embodies the Śakti Kūṭa (the third part of the Pāñcadaśākṣarī Mantra).

verses.original:
मूल-मन्त्रात्मिका मूलकूटत्रय-कलेबरा ।
कुलामृतैक-रसिका कुलसंकेत-पालिनी ॥ ३६॥
verses.transliteration:
mūla-mantrātmikā mūlakūṭatraya-kalebarā .
kulāmṛtaika-rasikā kulasaṃketa-pālinī .. 36..

translations.english: She is the soul of the root Mantra (Mūla Mantra), Her body is the three Kūṭas. She delights solely in the nectar of the Kula path, and is the protector of the Kula conventions.

verses.original:
कुलाङ्गना कुलान्तस्था कौलिनी कुलयोगिनी ।
अकुला समयान्तस्था समयाचार-तत्परा ॥ ३७॥
verses.transliteration:
kulāṅganā kulāntasthā kaulinī kulayoginī .
akulā samayāntasthā samayācāra-tatparā .. 37..

translations.english: She is the noble woman, dwelling within the Kula (lineage), the Kaulinī, the Yoginī of the Kula. She is also the transcendental (Akulā), dwelling within the Samaya path, devoted to the Samaya rituals.

verses.original:
मूलाधारैक-निलया ब्रह्मग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी ।
मणि-पूरान्तरुदिता विष्णुग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी ॥ ३८॥
verses.transliteration:
mūlādhāraika-nilayā brahmagranthi-vibhedinī .
maṇi-pūrāntaruditā viṣṇugranthi-vibhedinī .. 38..

translations.english: She resides exclusively in the Mūlādhāra cakra, piercing the Brahmā knot (Brahmagranthi). She rises within the Maṇipūra cakra, piercing the Viṣṇu knot (Viṣṇugranthi).

verses.original:
आज्ञा-चक्रान्तरालस्था रुद्रग्रन्थि-विभेदिनी ।
सहस्राराम्बुजारूढा सुधा-साराभिवर्षिणी ॥ ३९॥
verses.transliteration:
ājñā-cakrāntarālasthā rudragranthi-vibhedinī .
sahasrārāmbujārūḍhā sudhā-sārābhivarṣiṇī .. 39..

translations.english: She is situated in the Ājñā cakra, piercing the Rudra knot (Rudragranthi). Ascending to the thousand-petaled lotus (Sahasrāra), She showers the essence of nectar.

verses.original:
तडिल्लता-समरुचिः षट्चक्रोपरि-संस्थिता ।
महासक्तिः कुण्डलिनी बिसतन्तु-तनीयसी ॥ ४०॥
verses.transliteration:
taḍillatā-samaruciḥ ṣaṭcakropari-saṃsthitā .
mahāsaktiḥ kuṇḍalinī bisatantu-tanīyasī .. 40..

translations.english: Her radiance is like a flash of lightning, positioned above the six cakras. She is the Great Power (Mahāśakti), the Kuṇḍalinī, finer than the fiber of a lotus stem.

verses.original:
भवानी भावनागम्या भवारण्य-कुठारिका ।
भद्रप्रिया भद्रमूर्तिर् भक्त-सौभाग्यदायिनी ॥ ४१॥
verses.transliteration:
bhavānī bhāvanāgamyā bhavāraṇya-kuṭhārikā .
bhadrapriyā bhadramūrtir bhakta-saubhāgyadāyinī .. 41..

translations.english: She is Bhavānī, attainable only through profound meditation, the axe that cuts down the forest of Samsāra (existence). She loves auspiciousness, is the embodiment of auspiciousness, and grants good fortune to Her devotees.

verses.original:
भक्तिप्रिया भक्तिगम्या भक्तिवश्या भयापहा ।
शाम्भवी शारदाराध्या शर्वाणी शर्मदायिनी ॥ ४२॥
verses.transliteration:
bhaktipriyā bhaktigamyā bhaktivaśyā bhayāpahā .
śāmbhavī śāradārādhyā śarvāṇī śarmadāyinī .. 42..

translations.english: She is fond of devotion, attained by devotion, controlled by devotion, and the remover of fear. She is Śāmbhavī, worshipped by Śāradā (Sarasvatī), the consort of Śarva (Śiva), and the giver of happiness.

verses.original:
शाङ्करी श्रीकरी साध्वी शरच्चन्द्र-निभानना ।
शातोदरी शान्तिमती निराधारा निरञ्जना ॥ ४३॥
verses.transliteration:
śāṅkarī śrīkarī sādhvī śaraccandra-nibhānanā .
śātodarī śāntimatī nirādhārā nirañjanā .. 43..

translations.english: She is the source of all good (Śaṅkarī), the bestower of wealth (Śrīkarī), the virtuous one, whose face resembles the autumn moon. She has a slender belly, is full of peace, is without support, and is stainless.

verses.original:
निर्लेपा निर्मला नित्या निराकारा निराकुला ।
निर्गुणा निष्कला शान्ता निष्कामा निरुपप्लवा ॥ ४४॥
verses.transliteration:
nirlepā nirmalā nityā nirākārā nirākulā .
nirguṇā niṣkalā śāntā niṣkāmā nirupaplavā .. 44..

translations.english: She is untouched (Nirlepā), pure (Nirmalā), eternal (Nityā), formless (Nirākārā), unagitated (Nirākulā). She is without qualities (Nirguṇā), indivisible (Niṣkalā), peaceful (Śāntā), desireless (Niṣkāmā), and free from calamity (Nirupaplavā).

verses.original:
नित्यमुक्ता निर्विकारा निष्प्रपञ्चा निराश्रया ।
नित्यशुद्धा नित्यबुद्धा निरवद्या निरन्तरा ॥ ४५॥
verses.transliteration:
nityamuktā nirvikārā niṣprapañcā nirāśrayā .
nityaśuddhā nityabuddhā niravadyā nirantarā .. 45..

translations.english: She is eternally liberated (Nityamuktā), changeless (Nirvikārā), without the world (Niṣprapañcā), and without any support (Nirāśrayā). She is eternally pure, eternally enlightened, flawless, and continuous (pervading all).

verses.original:
निष्कारणा निष्कलङ्का निरुपाधिर् निरीश्वरा ।
नीरागा रागमथनी निर्मदा मदनाशिनी ॥ ४६॥
verses.transliteration:
niṣkāraṇā niṣkalaṅkā nirupādhir nirīśvarā .
nīrāgā rāgamathanī nirmadā madanāśinī .. 46..

translations.english: She is without cause, stainless, without limitation, and without any higher lord. She is without passion, the destroyer of passion, without arrogance, and the destroyer of arrogance.

verses.original:
निश्चिन्ता निरहंकारा निर्मोहा मोहनाशिनी ।
निर्ममा ममताहन्त्री निष्पापा पापनाशिनी ॥ ४७॥
verses.transliteration:
niścintā nirahaṃkārā nirmohā mohanāśinī .
nirmamā mamatāhantrī niṣpāpā pāpanāśinī .. 47..

translations.english: She is without worry, without ego, without delusion, and the destroyer of delusion. She is without possessiveness, the destroyer of attachment, sinless, and the destroyer of sin.

verses.original:
निष्क्रोधा क्रोधशमनी निर्लोभा लोभनाशिनी ।
निःसंशया संशयघ्नी निर्भवा भवनाशिनी ॥ ४८॥
verses.transliteration:
niṣkrodhā krodhaśamanī nirlobhā lobhanāśinī .
niḥsaṃśayā saṃśayaghnī nirbhavā bhavanāśinī .. 48..

translations.english: She is without anger, the pacifier of anger, without greed, and the destroyer of greed. She is without doubt, the remover of doubt, unborn, and the destroyer of the cycle of birth and death.

verses.original:
निर्विकल्पा निराबाधा निर्भेदा भेदनाशिनी ।
निर्नाशा मृत्युमथनी निष्क्रिया निष्परिग्रहा ॥ ४९॥
verses.transliteration:
nirvikalpā nirābādhā nirbhedā bhedanāśinī .
nirnāśā mṛtyumathanī niṣkriyā niṣparigrahā .. 49..

translations.english: She is without differentiation, unobstructed, without separation, and the destroyer of separateness. She is indestructible, the churner/destroyer of death, actionless, and free from acquisition.

verses.original:
निस्तुला नीलचिकुरा निरपाया निरत्यया ।
दुर्लभा दुर्गमा दुर्गा दुःखहन्त्री सुखप्रदा ॥ ५०॥
verses.transliteration:
nistulā nīlacikurā nirapāyā niratyayā .
durlabhā durgamā durgā duḥkhahantrī sukhapradā .. 50..

translations.english: She is incomparable, with beautiful blue-black hair, without deterioration, and never passing away. She is difficult to obtain, difficult to reach, the form of Durgā, the remover of sorrow, and the bestower of happiness.

verses.original:
दुष्टदूरा दुराचार-शमनी दोषवर्जिता ।
सर्वज्ञा सान्द्रकरुणा समानाधिक-वर्जिता ॥ ५१॥
verses.transliteration:
duṣṭadūrā durācāra-śamanī doṣavarjitā .
sarvajñā sāndrakaruṇā samānādhika-varjitā .. 51..

translations.english: She is far from the wicked, the pacifier of evil conduct, and free from all faults. She is omniscient, intensely compassionate, and has none equal to or greater than Her.

verses.original:
सर्वशक्तिमयी सर्व-मङ्गला सद्गतिप्रदा ।
सर्वेश्वरी सर्वमयी सर्वमन्त्र-स्वरूपिणी ॥ ५२॥
verses.transliteration:
sarvaśaktimayī sarva-maṅgalā sadgatipradā .
sarveśvarī sarvamayī sarvamantra-svarūpiṇī .. 52..

translations.english: She is the essence of all power, auspicious in every way, and the bestower of the right path (liberation). She is the ruler of all, pervading all, and the form of all Mantras.

verses.original:
सर्व-यन्त्रात्मिका सर्व-तन्त्ररूपा मनोन्मनी ।
माहेश्वरी महादेवी महालक्ष्मीर् मृडप्रिया ॥ ५३॥
verses.transliteration:
sarva-yantrātmikā sarva-tantrarūpā manonmanī .
māheśvarī mahādevī mahālakṣmīr mṛḍapriyā .. 53..

translations.english: She is the soul of all Yantras, the form of all Tantras, and the state of mindlessness (Manonmanī). She is the Great Goddess (Māheśvarī), the Great Goddess (Mahādevī), Mahālakṣmī, and the beloved of Mṛḍa (Śiva).

verses.original:
महारूपा महापूज्या महापातक-नाशिनी ।
महामाया महासत्त्वा महाशक्तिर् महारतिः ॥ ५४॥
verses.transliteration:
mahārūpā mahāpūjyā mahāpātaka-nāśinī .
mahāmāyā mahāsattvā mahāśaktir mahāratiḥ .. 54..

translations.english: She has a magnificent form, is greatly worshiped, and destroys great sins. She is the Great Illusory Power (Mahāmāyā), the Great Existence (Mahāsattvā), the Great Power (Mahāśakti), and the Great Delight (Mahāratiḥ).

verses.original:
महाभोगा महैश्वर्या महावीर्या महाबला ।
महाबुद्धिर् महासिद्धिर् महायोगेश्वरेश्वरी ॥ ५५॥
verses.transliteration:
mahābhogā mahaiśvaryā mahāvīryā mahābalā .
mahābuddhir mahāsiddhir mahāyogeśvareśvarī .. 55..

translations.english: She is the enjoyer of great pleasures, the possessor of great wealth, of great valor, and of great strength. She is the Great Intellect, the Great Accomplishment, and the ruler of the greatest masters of Yoga.

verses.original:
महातन्त्रा महामन्त्रा महायन्त्रा महासना ।
महायाग-क्रमाराध्या महाभैरव-पूजिता ॥ ५६॥
verses.transliteration:
mahātantrā mahāmantrā mahāyantrā mahāsanā .
mahāyāga-kramārādhyā mahābhairava-pūjitā .. 56..

translations.english: She is the Great Tantra, the Great Mantra, the Great Yantra, and the Great Seat. She is worshiped by the procedure of the Great Sacrifice, and is adored by Mahābhairava.

verses.original:
महेश्वर-महाकल्प-महाताण्डव-साक्षिणी ।
महाकामेश-महिषी महात्रिपुर-सुन्दरी ॥ ५७॥
verses.transliteration:
maheśvara-mahākalpa-mahātāṇḍava-sākṣiṇī .
mahākāmeśa-mahiṣī mahātripura-sundarī .. 57..

translations.english: She is the witness to the great cosmic dance (Mahātāṇḍava) of Maheśvara at the time of the Great Dissolution. She is the Empress of Mahākāmeśa, and the Great Beautiful One of the Three Cities (Mahātripurasundarī).

verses.original:
चतुःषष्ट्युपचाराढ्या चतुःषष्टिकलामयी ।
महाचतुः-षष्टिकोटि-योगिनी-गणसेविता ॥ ५८॥
verses.transliteration:
catuḥṣaṣṭyupacārāḍhyā catuḥṣaṣṭikalāmayī .
mahācatuḥ-ṣaṣṭikoṭi-yoginī-gaṇasevitā .. 58..

translations.english: She is rich with 64 forms of worship, and is the embodiment of 64 arts/Kalās. She is served by 64 crores of hosts of Yoginīs.

verses.original:
मनुविद्या चन्द्रविद्या चन्द्रमण्डल-मध्यगा ।
चारुरूपा चारुहासा चारुचन्द्र-कलाधरा ॥ ५९॥
verses.transliteration:
manuvidyā candravidyā candramaṇḍala-madhyagā .
cārurūpā cāruhāsā cārucandra-kalādharā .. 59..

translations.english: She is the Manu Vidyā (Mantra of Manu), the Candra Vidyā (Mantra of the Moon), and dwells in the center of the lunar orb. She has a beautiful form, a beautiful smile, and wears a beautiful crescent moon.

verses.original:
चराचर-जगन्नाथा चक्रराज-निकेतना ।
पार्वती पद्मनयना पद्मराग-समप्रभा ॥ ६०॥
verses.transliteration:
carācara-jagannāthā cakrarāja-niketanā .
pārvatī padmanayanā padmarāga-samaprabhā .. 60..

translations.english: She is the mistress of the moving and non-moving world, and Her abode is the Śrī Cakra (Cakrarāja). She is Pārvatī, has lotus-like eyes, and Her radiance is like the Padmarāga gem.

verses.original:
पञ्च-प्रेतासनासीना पञ्चब्रह्म-स्वरूपिणी ।
चिन्मयी परमानन्दा विज्ञान-घनरूपिणी ॥ ६१॥
verses.transliteration:
pañca-pretāsanāsīnā pañcabrahma-svarūpiṇī .
cinmayī paramānandā vijñāna-ghanarūpiṇī .. 61..

translations.english: She is seated on the throne of the five corpses (Pañca-Preta), and is the very form of the five Brahmās. She is full of consciousness (Cinmayī), the Supreme Bliss (Paramānandā), and the dense form of pure knowledge (Vijñāna-Ghana).

verses.original:
ध्यान-ध्यातृ-ध्येयरूपा धर्माधर्म-विवर्जिता ।
विश्वरूपा जागरिणी स्वपन्ती तैजसात्मिका ॥ ६२॥
verses.transliteration:
dhyāna-dhyātṛ-dhyeyarūpā dharmādharma-vivarjitā .
viśvarūpā jāgariṇī svapantī taijasātmikā .. 62..

translations.english: She is the form of meditation, the meditator, and the object of meditation, transcending virtue and sin. She is the universal form (Viśvarūpā), the waking state, the dreaming state (Svapantī), and the soul of the subtle body (Taijasātmikā).

verses.original:
सुप्ता प्राज्ञात्मिका तुर्या सर्वावस्था-विवर्जिता ।
सृष्टिकर्त्री ब्रह्मरूपा गोप्त्री गोविन्दरूपिणी ॥ ६३॥
verses.transliteration:
suptā prājñātmikā turyā sarvāvasthā-vivarjitā .
sṛṣṭikartrī brahmarūpā goptrī govindarūpiṇī .. 63..

translations.english: She is the deep sleep state (Suptā), the soul of the causal body (Prājñātmikā), the Fourth state (Turyā), and free from all states. She is the creator (Brahmā-rūpā), the preserver (Govinda-rūpiṇī).

verses.original:
संहारिणी रुद्ररूपा तिरोधान-करीश्वरी ।
सदाशिवाऽनुग्रहदा पञ्चकृत्य-परायणा ॥ ६४॥
verses.transliteration:
saṃhāriṇī rudrarūpā tirodhāna-karīśvarī .
sadāśivā’nugrahadā pañcakṛtya-parāyaṇā .. 64..

translations.english: She is the destroyer (Rudra-rūpā), the concealer, the supreme ruler. She is Sadāśivā, the bestower of grace, and devoted to the five cosmic functions (Pañcakṛtya).

verses.original:
भानुमण्डल-मध्यस्था भैरवी भगमालिनी ।
पद्मासना भगवती पद्मनाभ-सहोदरी ॥ ६५॥
verses.transliteration:
bhānumaṇḍala-madhyasthā bhairavī bhagamālinī .
padmāsanā bhagavatī padmanābha-sahodarī .. 65..

translations.english: She dwells in the center of the solar orb, is Bhairavī and Bhagamālinī. She is seated on the lotus pose (Padmāsanā), the revered Goddess, and the sister of Padmanābha (Viṣṇu).

verses.original:
उन्मेष-निमिषोत्पन्न-विपन्न-भुवनावली ।
सहस्र-शीर्षवदना सहस्राक्षी सहस्रपात् ॥ ६६॥
verses.transliteration:
unmeṣa-nimiṣotpanna-vipanna-bhuvanāvalī .
sahasra-śīrṣavadanā sahasrākṣī sahasrapāt .. 66..

translations.english: The entire universe is created and destroyed by the opening and closing of Her eyes. She has a thousand heads and faces, a thousand eyes, and a thousand feet.

verses.original:
आब्रह्म-कीट-जननी वर्णाश्रम-विधायिनी ।
निजाज्ञारूप-निगमा पुण्यापुण्य-फलप्रदा ॥ ६७॥
verses.transliteration:
ābrahma-kīṭa-jananī varṇāśrama-vidhāyinī .
nijājñārūpa-nigamā puṇyāpuṇya-phalapradā .. 67..

translations.english: She is the mother of all from Brahmā down to a worm, and the ordainer of the caste and stage of life (Varṇāśrama). The Vedas are Her commandments, and She bestows the fruits of good and bad deeds.

verses.original:
श्रुति-सीमन्त-सिन्दूरी-कृत-पादाब्ज-धूलिका ।
सकलागम-सन्दोह-शुक्ति-सम्पुट-मौक्तिका ॥ ६८॥
verses.transliteration:
śruti-sīmanta-sindūrī-kṛta-pādābja-dhūlikā .
sakalāgama-sandoha-śukti-sampuṭa-mauktikā .. 68..

translations.english: The dust of Her lotus-feet is the vermillion applied to the parting of the hair (Sīmanta) of the Śrutis (Vedas). She is the pearl contained in the oyster shell of the collective body of all Āgamas.

verses.original:
पुरुषार्थप्रदा पूर्णा भोगिनी भुवनेश्वरी ।
अम्बिकाऽनादि-निधना हरिब्रह्मेन्द्र-सेविता ॥ ६९॥
verses.transliteration:
puruṣārthapradā pūrṇā bhoginī bhuvaneśvarī .
ambikā’nādi-nidhanā haribrahmendra-sevitā .. 69..

translations.english: She grants the four aims of human life (Puruṣārthas), is complete, the enjoyer, and the ruler of the worlds. She is Ambikā, without beginning or end, and is served by Hari (Viṣṇu), Brahmā, and Indra.

verses.original:
नारायणी नादरूपा नामरूप-विवर्जिता ।
ह्रींकारी ह्रीमती हृद्या हेयोपादेय-वर्जिता ॥ ७०॥
verses.transliteration:
nārāyaṇī nādarūpā nāmarūpa-vivarjitā .
hrīṃkārī hrīmatī hṛdyā heyopādeya-varjitā .. 70..

translations.english: She is Nārāyaṇī, the form of sound (Nāda), and is free from name and form. She is the sound of Hriṁ, modest, delightful to the heart, and free from anything to be rejected or accepted.

verses.original:
राजराजार्चिता राज्ञी रम्या राजीवलोचना ।
रञ्जनी रमणी रस्या रणत्किङ्किणि-मेखला ॥ ७१॥
verses.transliteration:
rājarājārcitā rājñī ramyā rājīvalocanā .
rañjanī ramaṇī rasyā raṇatkiṅkiṇi-mekhalā .. 71..

translations.english: She is worshiped by the king of kings (Kubera), the queen, beautiful, and lotus-eyed. She gives delight, is pleasing, full of flavor, and has a girdle with tinkling small bells.

verses.original:
रमा राकेन्दुवदना रतिरूपा रतिप्रिया ।
रक्षाकरी राक्षसघ्नी रामा रमणलम्पटा ॥ ७२॥
verses.transliteration:
ramā rākenduvadanā ratirūpā ratipriyā .
rakṣākarī rākṣasaghnī rāmā ramaṇalampaṭā .. 72..

translations.english: She is Lakṣmī (Ramā), whose face is like the full moon, the form of Rati (goddess of love), and fond of Rati. She is the protectress, the killer of demons, beautiful, and passionately attached to Her lover (Kāmeśvara).

verses.original:
काम्या कामकलारूपा कदम्ब-कुसुम-प्रिया ।
कल्याणी जगतीकन्दा करुणा-रस-सागरा ॥ ७३॥
verses.transliteration:
kāmyā kāmakalārūpā kadamba-kusuma-priyā .
kalyāṇī jagatīkandā karuṇā-rasa-sāgarā .. 73..

translations.english: She is desirable, the form of Kāmakalā, and fond of Kadamba flowers. She is auspicious (Kalyāṇī), the root of the world, and an ocean of the nectar of compassion.

verses.original:
कलावती कलालापा कान्ता कादम्बरीप्रिया ।
वरदा वामनयना वारुणी-मद-विह्वला ॥ ७४॥
verses.transliteration:
kalāvatī kalālāpā kāntā kādambarīpriyā .
varadā vāmanayanā vāruṇī-mada-vihvalā .. 74..

translations.english: She is accomplished in arts, whose speech is artistic, lovely, and fond of liquor (Kādambarī). She grants boons, has beautiful eyes, and is intoxicated with the liquor of Vāruṇī.

verses.original:
विश्वाधिका वेदवेद्या विन्ध्याचल-निवासिनी ।
विधात्री वेदजननी विष्णुमाया विलासिनी ॥ ७५॥
verses.transliteration:
viśvādhikā vedavedyā vindhyācala-nivāsinī .
vidhātrī vedajananī viṣṇumāyā vilāsinī .. 75..

translations.english: She transcends the universe, is known through the Vedas, and resides on the Vindhyācala mountain. She is the creatrix, the mother of the Vedas, the illusory power of Viṣṇu, and the playful one.

verses.original:
क्षेत्रस्वरूपा क्षेत्रेशी क्षेत्र-क्षेत्रज्ञ-पालिनी ।
क्षयवृद्धि-विनिर्मुक्ता क्षेत्रपाल-समर्चिता ॥ ७६॥
verses.transliteration:
kṣetrasvarūpā kṣetreśī kṣetra-kṣetrajña-pālinī .
kṣayavṛddhi-vinirmuktā kṣetrapāla-samarcitā .. 76..

translations.english: She is the form of the physical field (Kṣetra), the ruler of the field, and the protectress of the field and the knower of the field. She is free from decay and growth, and is worshiped by the guardian deities of the field.

verses.original:
विजया विमला वन्द्या वन्दारु-जन-वत्सला ।
वाग्वादिनी वामकेशी वह्निमण्डल-वासिनी ॥ ७७॥
verses.transliteration:
vijayā vimalā vandyā vandāru-jana-vatsalā .
vāgvādinī vāmakeśī vahnimaṇḍala-vāsinī .. 77..

translations.english: She is victorious (Vijayā), pure, venerable, and affectionate towards Her devotees. She is the bestower of speech (Vāgvādinī), has beautiful hair, and resides in the orb of fire (Vahnimaṇḍala).

verses.original:
भक्तिमत्-कल्पलतिका पशुपाश-विमोचिनी ।
संहृताशेष-पाषण्डा सदाचार-प्रवर्तिका ॥ ७८॥
verses.transliteration:
bhaktimat-kalpalatikā paśupāśa-vimocinī .
saṃhṛtāśeṣa-pāṣaṇḍā sadācāra-pravartikā .. 78..

translations.english: She is the wish-fulfilling creeper for the devotee, and releases creatures (Paśus) from their bondage (Pāśa). She destroys all heretics (Pāṣaṇḍas), and promotes righteous conduct.

verses.original:
तापत्रयाग्नि-सन्तप्त-समाह्लादन-चन्द्रिका ।
तरुणी तापसाराध्या तनुमध्या तमोऽपहा ॥ ७९॥
verses.transliteration:
tāpatrayāgni-santapta-samāhlādana-candrikā .
taruṇī tāpasārādhyā tanumadhyā tamo’pahā .. 79..

translations.english: She is the moonlight that cools those burned by the fire of the three miseries (Tāpatraya). She is eternally youthful, worshiped by ascetics, has a slender waist, and removes darkness.

verses.original:
चितिस्तत्पद-लक्ष्यार्था चिदेकरस-रूपिणी ।
स्वात्मानन्द-लवीभूत-ब्रह्माद्यानन्द-सन्ततिः ॥ ८०॥
verses.transliteration:
citistatpada-lakṣyārthā cidekarasa-rūpiṇī .
svātmānanda-lavībhūta-brahmādyānanda-santatiḥ .. 80..

translations.english: She is pure Consciousness, the implied meaning of the word 'That' (Tat) in Vedic statements, and the form of the one essence of consciousness. The happiness of Brahmā and others is but a fraction of Her own bliss.

verses.original:
परा प्रत्यक्चितीरूपा पश्यन्ती परदेवता ।
मध्यमा वैखरीरूपा भक्त-मानस-हंसिका ॥ ८१॥
verses.transliteration:
parā pratyakcitīrūpā paśyantī paradevatā .
madhyamā vaikharīrūpā bhakta-mānasa-haṃsikā .. 81..

translations.english: She is the transcendent (Parā), the inner consciousness, the witnessing power (Paśyantī), the Supreme Deity. She is the intermediate speech (Madhyamā) and the uttered speech (Vaikharī), and the swan in the mind-lake of Her devotees.

verses.original:
कामेश्वर-प्राणनाडी कृतज्ञा कामपूजिता ।
श‍ृङ्गार-रस-सम्पूर्णा जया जालन्धर-स्थिता ॥ ८२॥
verses.transliteration:
kāmeśvara-prāṇanāḍī kṛtajñā kāmapūjitā .
śṛṅgāra-rasa-sampūrṇā jayā jālandhara-sthitā .. 82..

translations.english: She is the very life-breath of Kāmeśvara, the knower of gratitude, and worshiped by Kāma. She is full of the erotic sentiment, victorious, and resides in Jālandhara Pīṭha.

verses.original:
ओड्याणपीठ-निलया बिन्दु-मण्डलवासिनी ।
रहोयाग-क्रमाराध्या रहस्तर्पण-तर्पिता ॥ ८३॥
verses.transliteration:
oḍyāṇapīṭha-nilayā bindu-maṇḍalavāsinī .
rahoyāga-kramārādhyā rahastarpaṇa-tarpitā .. 83..

translations.english: She resides in the Oḍyāṇa Pīṭha, and dwells in the Bindu Maṇḍala. She is worshiped by secret sacrificial procedures, and satisfied by secret libations.

verses.original:
सद्यःप्रसादिनी विश्व-साक्षिणी साक्षिवर्जिता ।
षडङ्गदेवता-युक्ता षाड्गुण्य-परिपूरिता ॥ ८४॥
verses.transliteration:
sadyaḥprasādinī viśva-sākṣiṇī sākṣivarjitā .
ṣaḍaṅgadevatā-yuktā ṣāḍguṇya-paripūritā .. 84..

translations.english: She is quickly granting grace, the witness of the universe, and herself without a witness. She is accompanied by the deities of the six ancillary parts, and complete with the six divine qualities.

verses.original:
नित्यक्लिन्ना निरुपमा निर्वाण-सुख-दायिनी ।
नित्या-षोडशिका-रूपा श्रीकण्ठार्ध-शरीरिणी ॥ ८५॥
verses.transliteration:
nityaklinnā nirupamā nirvāṇa-sukha-dāyinī .
nityā-ṣoḍaśikā-rūpā śrīkaṇṭhārdha-śarīriṇī .. 85..

translations.english: She is eternally compassionate, incomparable, and the bestower of the bliss of liberation. She is the form of the eternal sixteen deities (Nityās), and possesses half the body of Śrīkaṇṭha (Śiva).

verses.original:
प्रभावती प्रभारूपा प्रसिद्धा परमेश्वरी ।
मूलप्रकृतिर् अव्यक्ता व्यक्ताव्यक्त-स्वरूपिणी ॥ ८६॥
verses.transliteration:
prabhāvatī prabhārūpā prasiddhā parameśvarī .
mūlaprakṛtir avyaktā vyaktāvyakta-svarūpiṇī .. 86..

translations.english: She is luminous, the form of radiance, famous, and the Supreme Queen. She is the Mūlaprakṛti (root nature), the unmanifest, and the form of the manifest and the unmanifest.

verses.original:
व्यापिनी विविधाकारा विद्याविद्या-स्वरूपिणी ।
महाकामेश-नयन-कुमुदाह्लाद-कौमुदी ॥ ८७॥
verses.transliteration:
vyāpinī vividhākārā vidyāvidyā-svarūpiṇī .
mahākāmeśa-nayana-kumudāhlāda-kaumudī .. 87..

translations.english: She is pervasive, of various forms, and the form of knowledge and ignorance. She is the moonlight that delights the night-lotus that is the eye of Mahākāmeśa.

verses.original:
भक्त-हार्द-तमोभेद-भानुमद्भानु-सन्ततिः ।
शिवदूती शिवाराध्या शिवमूर्तिः शिवङ्करी ॥ ८८॥
verses.transliteration:
bhakta-hārda-tamobheda-bhānumadbhānu-santatiḥ .
śivadūtī śivārādhyā śivamūrtiḥ śivaṅkarī .. 88..

translations.english: She is the series of suns that dispel the darkness in the heart of Her devotee. She is Śiva's messenger, worshiped by Śiva, the embodiment of Śiva, and the bestower of welfare.

verses.original:
शिवप्रिया शिवपरा शिष्टेष्टा शिष्टपूजिता ।
अप्रमेया स्वप्रकाशा मनोवाचामगोचरा ॥ ८९॥
verses.transliteration:
śivapriyā śivaparā śiṣṭeṣṭā śiṣṭapūjitā .
aprameyā svaprakāśā manovācāmagocarā .. 89..

translations.english: She is dear to Śiva, devoted to Śiva, desired by the noble, and worshiped by the noble. She is immeasurable, self-luminous, and beyond the reach of mind and speech.

verses.original:
चिच्छक्तिश् चेतनारूपा जडशक्तिर् जडात्मिका ।
गायत्री व्याहृतिः सन्ध्या द्विजबृन्द-निषेविता ॥ ९०॥
verses.transliteration:
cicchaktiś cetanārūpā jaḍaśaktir jaḍātmikā .
gāyatrī vyāhṛtiḥ sandhyā dvijabṛnda-niṣevitā .. 90..

translations.english: She is the power of consciousness, the form of intelligence, and the inert power which is the soul of all inert things. She is Gāyatrī, the mystic utterance (Vyāhṛti), the junction period (Sandhyā), and is served by the host of twice-born people.

verses.original:
तत्त्वासना तत्त्वमयी पञ्च-कोशान्तर-स्थिता ।
निःसीम-महिमा नित्य-यौवना मदशालिनी ॥ ९१॥
verses.transliteration:
tattvāsanā tattvamayī pañca-kośāntara-sthitā .
niḥsīma-mahimā nitya-yauvanā madaśālinī .. 91..

translations.english: She has the principles (Tattvas) as Her seat, is the essence of the Tattvas, and dwells within the five sheaths (Pañca-kośa). She has boundless glory, is eternally youthful, and full of intoxicating charm.

verses.original:
मदघूर्णित-रक्ताक्षी मदपाटल-गण्डभूः ।
चन्दन-द्रव-दिग्धाङ्गी चाम्पेय-कुसुम-प्रिया ॥ ९२॥
verses.transliteration:
madaghūrṇita-raktākṣī madapāṭala-gaṇḍabhūḥ .
candana-drava-digdhāṅgī cāmpeya-kusuma-priyā .. 92..

translations.english: Her red eyes are rolling due to intoxication, and Her cheeks are rosy due to intoxication. Her limbs are smeared with sandal paste, and She is fond of Campaka flowers.

verses.original:
कुशला कोमलाकारा कुरुकुल्ला कुलेश्वरी ।
कुलकुण्डालया कौल-मार्ग-तत्पर-सेविता ॥ ९३॥
verses.transliteration:
kuśalā komalākārā kurukullā kuleśvarī .
kulakuṇḍālayā kaula-mārga-tatpara-sevitā .. 93..

translations.english: She is skillful, of delicate form, Kurukullā, and the ruler of the lineage (Kuleśvarī). She resides in the Kulakuṇḍa (Mūlādhāra), and is served by those devoted to the Kaula path.

verses.original:
कुमार-गणनाथाम्बा तुष्टिः पुष्टिर् मतिर् धृतिः ।
शान्तिः स्वस्तिमती कान्तिर् नन्दिनी विघ्ननाशिनी ॥ ९४॥
verses.transliteration:
kumāra-gaṇanāthāmbā tuṣṭiḥ puṣṭir matir dhṛtiḥ .
śāntiḥ svastimatī kāntir nandinī vighnanāśinī .. 94..

translations.english: She is the mother of Kumāra (Kārttikeya) and Gaṇanātha (Gaṇeśa), and the embodiment of contentment, nourishment, intellect, fortitude, peace, auspiciousness, radiance, delight, and the destroyer of obstacles.

verses.original:
तेजोवती त्रिनयना लोलाक्षी-कामरूपिणी ।
मालिनी हंसिनी माता मलयाचल-वासिनी ॥ ९५॥
verses.transliteration:
tejovatī trinayanā lolākṣī-kāmarūpiṇī .
mālinī haṃsinī mātā malayācala-vāsinī .. 95..

translations.english: She is full of splendor, three-eyed, the form of the beautiful-eyed Kāma. She is the possessor of the garland of letters (Mālinī), the swan, the Mother, and resides on the Malaya mountain.

verses.original:
सुमुखी नलिनी सुभ्रूः शोभना सुरनायिका ।
कालकण्ठी कान्तिमती क्षोभिणी सूक्ष्मरूपिणी ॥ ९६॥
verses.transliteration:
sumukhī nalinī subhrūḥ śobhanā suranāyikā .
kālakaṇṭhī kāntimatī kṣobhiṇī sūkṣmarūpiṇī .. 96..

translations.english: She has a beautiful face, is like a lotus, has beautiful eyebrows, is splendid, and the leader of the Devas. She is the consort of the blue-throated one (Śiva), radiant, the shaker (of the world), and of subtle form.

verses.original:
वज्रेश्वरी वामदेवी वयोऽवस्था-विवर्जिता ।
सिद्धेश्वरी सिद्धविद्या सिद्धमाता यशस्विनी ॥ ९७॥
verses.transliteration:
vajreśvarī vāmadevī vayo’vasthā-vivarjitā .
siddheśvarī siddhavidyā siddhamātā yaśasvinī .. 97..

translations.english: She is the goddess of the Vajra, the consort of Vāmadeva (Śiva), and free from the effects of age and condition. She is the ruler of Siddhas, the form of the perfected knowledge, the mother of Siddhas, and famous.

verses.original:
विशुद्धिचक्र-निलयाऽऽरक्तवर्णा त्रिलोचना ।
खट्वाङ्गादि-प्रहरणा वदनैक-समन्विता ॥ ९८॥
verses.transliteration:
viśuddhicakra-nilayā”raktavarṇā trilocanā .
khaṭvāṅgādi-praharaṇā vadanaika-samanvitā .. 98..

translations.english: She resides in the Viśuddhi cakra, is of reddish color, and has three eyes. She is armed with a staff (Khaṭvāṅga) and other weapons, and possesses one face.

verses.original:
पायसान्नप्रिया त्वक्स्था पशुलोक-भयङ्करी ।
अमृतादि-महाशक्ति-संवृता डाकिनीश्वरी ॥ ९९॥
verses.transliteration:
pāyasānnapriyā tvaksthā paśuloka-bhayaṅkarī .
amṛtādi-mahāśakti-saṃvṛtā ḍākinīśvarī .. 99..

translations.english: She is fond of rice-pudding (Pāyasānna), resides in the skin, and causes fear to the world of bound souls. She is surrounded by the Great Śaktis like Amṛtā, and is the ruler of the Ḍākinīs (Ḍākinīśvarī).

verses.original:
अनाहताब्ज-निलया श्यामाभा वदनद्वया ।
दंष्ट्रोज्ज्वलाऽक्ष-मालादि-धरा रुधिरसंस्थिता ॥ १००॥
verses.transliteration:
anāhatābja-nilayā śyāmābhā vadanadvayā .
daṃṣṭrojjvalā’kṣa-mālādi-dharā rudhirasaṃsthitā .. 100..

translations.english: She resides in the Anāhata lotus, is of a dusky complexion, and has two faces. She is brilliant with fangs, holds a rosary and other items, and resides in the element of blood.

verses.original:
कालरात्र्यादि-शक्त्यौघ-वृता स्निग्धौदनप्रिया ।
महावीरेन्द्र-वरदा राकिण्यम्बा-स्वरूपिणी ॥ १०१॥
verses.transliteration:
kālarātryādi-śaktyaugha-vṛtā snigdhaudanapriyā .
mahāvīrendra-varadā rākiṇyambā-svarūpiṇī .. 101..

translations.english: She is surrounded by hosts of Śaktis like Kālarātri, fond of oiled rice, grants boons to the great and brave heroes, and is the form of Rākiṇyambā (the presiding deity of the Viśuddhi Cakra).

verses.original:
मणिपूराब्ज-निलया वदनत्रय-संयुता ।
वज्रादिकायुधोपेता डामर्यादिभिरावृता ॥ १०२॥
verses.transliteration:
maṇipūrābja-nilayā vadanatraya-saṃyutā .
vajrādikāyudhopetā ḍāmaryādibhirāvṛtā .. 102..

translations.english: She resides in the Maṇipūra lotus, possesses three faces, is armed with the Vajra and other weapons, and is surrounded by Ḍāmarī and others.

verses.original:
रक्तवर्णा मांसनिष्ठा गुडान्न-प्रीत-मानसा ।
समस्तभक्त-सुखदा लाकिन्यम्बा-स्वरूपिणी ॥ १०३॥
verses.transliteration:
raktavarṇā māṃsaniṣṭhā guḍānna-prīta-mānasā .
samastabhakta-sukhadā lākinyambā-svarūpiṇī .. 103..

translations.english: She is red-colored, established in the element of flesh, delighted by rice mixed with jaggery, grants happiness to all devotees, and is the form of Lākinyambā (the presiding deity of the Maṇipūra Cakra).

verses.original:
स्वाधिष्ठानाम्बुज-गता चतुर्वक्त्र-मनोहरा ।
शूलाद्यायुध-सम्पन्ना पीतवर्णाऽतिगर्विता ॥ १०४॥
verses.transliteration:
svādhiṣṭhānāmbuja-gatā caturvaktra-manoharā .
śūlādyāyudha-sampannā pītavarṇā’tigarvitā .. 104..

translations.english: She resides in the Svādhiṣṭhāna lotus, is charming with four faces, possesses the trident and other weapons, is yellow-colored, and exceedingly proud.

verses.original:
मेदोनिष्ठा मधुप्रीता बन्धिन्यादि-समन्विता ।
दध्यन्नासक्त-हृदया काकिनी-रूप-धारिणी ॥ १०५॥
verses.transliteration:
medoniṣṭhā madhuprītā bandhinyādi-samanvitā .
dadhyannāsakta-hṛdayā kākinī-rūpa-dhāriṇī .. 105..

translations.english: She is established in the element of fat, fond of honey, surrounded by Bandhinī and others, whose heart is attached to curd-rice, and who holds the form of Kākinī (the presiding deity of the Svādhiṣṭhāna Cakra).

verses.original:
मूलाधाराम्बुजारूढा पञ्च-वक्त्राऽस्थि-संस्थिता ।
अङ्कुशादि-प्रहरणा वरदादि-निषेविता ॥ १०६॥
verses.transliteration:
mūlādhārāmbujārūḍhā pañca-vaktrā’sthi-saṃsthitā .
aṅkuśādi-praharaṇā varadādi-niṣevitā .. 106..

translations.english: She is seated on the Mūlādhāra lotus, has five faces, resides in the element of bone, is armed with the goad and other weapons, and is served by Varadā and others.

verses.original:
मुद्गौदनासक्त-चित्ता साकिन्यम्बा-स्वरूपिणी ।
आज्ञा-चक्राब्ज-निलया शुक्लवर्णा षडानना ॥ १०७॥
verses.transliteration:
mudgaudanāsakta-cittā sākinyambā-svarūpiṇī .
ājñā-cakrābja-nilayā śuklavarṇā ṣaḍānanā .. 107..

translations.english: Her mind is attached to Mung-bean rice, and She is the form of Sākinyambā (the presiding deity of the Mūlādhāra Cakra). She resides in the Ājñā Cakra lotus, is white-colored, and has six faces.

verses.original:
मज्जासंस्था हंसवती-मुख्य-शक्ति-समन्विता ।
हरिद्रान्नैक-रसिका हाकिनी-रूप-धारिणी ॥ १०८॥
verses.transliteration:
majjāsaṃsthā haṃsavatī-mukhya-śakti-samanvitā .
haridrānnaika-rasikā hākinī-rūpa-dhāriṇī .. 108..

translations.english: She is established in the element of marrow, accompanied by chief Śaktis like Haṃsavatī, relishes turmeric rice alone, and holds the form of Hākinī (the presiding deity of the Ājñā Cakra).

verses.original:
सहस्रदल-पद्मस्था सर्व-वर्णोप-शोभिता ।
सर्वायुधधरा शुक्ल-संस्थिता सर्वतोमुखी ॥ १०९॥
verses.transliteration:
sahasradala-padmasthā sarva-varṇopa-śobhitā .
sarvāyudhadharā śukla-saṃsthitā sarvatomukhī .. 109..

translations.english: She resides in the thousand-petalled lotus (Sahasrāra), shines with all colors, holds all weapons, is established in the element of semen (Śukla), and faces all directions.

verses.original:
सर्वौदन-प्रीतचित्ता याकिन्यम्बा-स्वरूपिणी ।
स्वाहा स्वधाऽमतिर् मेधा श्रुतिः स्मृतिर् अनुत्तमा ॥ ११०॥
verses.transliteration:
sarvaudana-prītacittā yākinyambā-svarūpiṇī .
svāhā svadhā’matir medhā śrutiḥ smṛtir anuttamā .. 110..

translations.english: Her mind is pleased with all kinds of rice, and She is the form of Yākinyambā (the presiding deity of the Sahasrāra Cakra). She is Svāhā (oblation to Devas), Svadhā (oblation to Manes), want of intellect (Amati), intellect (Medhā), Śruti (Vedas), Smṛti (tradition), and the supreme.

verses.original:
पुण्यकीर्तिः पुण्यलभ्या पुण्यश्रवण-कीर्तना ।
पुलोमजार्चिता बन्ध-मोचनी बन्धुरालका ॥ १११॥
verses.transliteration:
puṇyakīrtiḥ puṇyalabhyā puṇyaśravaṇa-kīrtanā .
pulomajārcitā bandha-mocanī bandhurālakā .. 111..

translations.english: She is of meritorious fame, attainable through merit, hearing and chanting Her names grants merit. She is worshiped by Pulomajā (Śacī, Indra's wife), releases from bondage, and has beautiful curling hair.

verses.original:
विमर्शरूपिणी विद्या वियदादि-जगत्प्रसूः ।
सर्वव्याधि-प्रशमनी सर्वमृत्यु-निवारिणी ॥ ११२॥
verses.transliteration:
vimarśarūpiṇī vidyā viyadādi-jagatprasūḥ .
sarvavyādhi-praśamanī sarvamṛtyu-nivāriṇī .. 112..

translations.english: She is the form of Vimarśa (reflecting consciousness), knowledge (Vidyā), and the mother of the universe starting with the sky. She is the pacifier of all diseases and the remover of all forms of death.

verses.original:
अग्रगण्याऽचिन्त्यरूपा कलिकल्मष-नाशिनी ।
कात्यायनी कालहन्त्री कमलाक्ष-निषेविता ॥ ११३॥
verses.transliteration:
agragaṇyā’cintyarūpā kalikalmaṣa-nāśinī .
kātyāyanī kālahantrī kamalākṣa-niṣevitā .. 113..

translations.english: She is to be counted first, of inconceivable form, the destroyer of the evils of the Kali Yuga. She is Kātyāyanī, the destroyer of Kāla (Time/Death), and served by the lotus-eyed one (Viṣṇu).

verses.original:
ताम्बूल-पूरित-मुखी दाडिमी-कुसुम-प्रभा ।
मृगाक्षी मोहिनी मुख्या मृडानी मित्ररूपिणी ॥ ११४॥
verses.transliteration:
tāmbūla-pūrita-mukhī dāḍimī-kusuma-prabhā .
mṛgākṣī mohinī mukhyā mṛḍānī mitrarūpiṇī .. 114..

translations.english: Her mouth is full of betel-nut, Her luster is like a pomegranate flower. She has eyes like a deer, is the bewilderer, the chief, Mṛḍānī (Pārvatī), and the form of the Sun-God (Mitrarūpiṇī).

verses.original:
नित्यतृप्ता भक्तनिधिर् नियन्त्री निखिलेश्वरी ।
मैत्र्यादि-वासनालभ्या महाप्रलय-साक्षिणी ॥ ११५॥
verses.transliteration:
nityatṛptā bhaktanidhir niyantrī nikhileśvarī .
maitryādi-vāsanālabhyā mahāpralaya-sākṣiṇī .. 115..

translations.english: She is eternally contented, a treasure for Her devotees, the controller, and the ruler of all. She is attained through pure tendencies (Vāsanā) like friendship (Maitrī), and is the witness of the great cosmic dissolution.

verses.original:
परा शक्तिः परा निष्ठा प्रज्ञानघन-रूपिणी ।
माध्वीपानालसा मत्ता मातृका-वर्ण-रूपिणी ॥ ११६॥
verses.transliteration:
parā śaktiḥ parā niṣṭhā prajñānaghana-rūpiṇī .
mādhvīpānālasā mattā mātṛkā-varṇa-rūpiṇī .. 116..

translations.english: She is the supreme power (Parā Śakti), the supreme dwelling place (Parā Niṣṭhā), and the form of solidified pure consciousness (Prajñānaghana). She is languid from drinking Madhvī (liquor/nectar), intoxicated, and the form of the letters of the alphabet (Mātṛkā-Varṇa).

verses.original:
महाकैलास-निलया मृणाल-मृदु-दोर्लता ।
महनीया दयामूर्तिर् महासाम्राज्य-शालिनी ॥ ११७॥
verses.transliteration:
mahākailāsa-nilayā mṛṇāla-mṛdu-dorlatā .
mahanīyā dayāmūrtir mahāsāmrājya-śālinī .. 117..

translations.english: She resides in Mahākailāsa, Her creeper-like arms are soft as lotus stalks. She is venerable, the embodiment of compassion, and possesses a great empire.

verses.original:
आत्मविद्या महाविद्या श्रीविद्या कामसेविता ।
श्री-षोडशाक्षरी-विद्या त्रिकूटा कामकोटिका ॥ ११८॥
verses.transliteration:
ātmavidyā mahāvidyā śrīvidyā kāmasevitā .
śrī-ṣoḍaśākṣarī-vidyā trikūṭā kāmakoṭikā .. 118..

translations.english: She is the knowledge of the Self, the great knowledge, the Śrī Vidyā, and served by Kāma. She is the Śrī-Śoḍaśākṣarī Vidyā (Sixteen-lettered Mantra), the three-peaked one (Trikūṭā), and the source of infinite desires (Kāmakoṭikā).

verses.original:
कटाक्ष-किङ्करी-भूत-कमला-कोटि-सेविता ।
शिरःस्थिता चन्द्रनिभा भालस्थेन्द्र-धनुःप्रभा ॥ ११९॥
verses.transliteration:
kaṭākṣa-kiṅkarī-bhūta-kamalā-koṭi-sevitā .
śiraḥsthitā candranibhā bhālasthendra-dhanuḥprabhā .. 119..

translations.english: She is served by millions of Lakṣmīs (Kamalā) who are merely Her servants by a side-glance. She resides on the head (Sahasrāra) shining like the moon, and resides on the forehead (Ājñā) shining like a rainbow.

verses.original:
हृदयस्था रविप्रख्या त्रिकोणान्तर-दीपिका ।
दाक्षायणी दैत्यहन्त्री दक्षयज्ञ-विनाशिनी ॥ १२०॥
verses.transliteration:
hṛdayasthā raviprakhyā trikoṇāntara-dīpikā .
dākṣāyaṇī daityahantrī dakṣayajña-vināśinī .. 120..

translations.english: She resides in the heart (Anāhata) shining like the sun, and is the light within the triangle (Mūlādhāra/Yoni). She is Dākṣāyaṇī, the destroyer of demons, and the destroyer of Dakṣa's sacrifice.

verses.original:
दरान्दोलित-दीर्घाक्षी दर-हासोज्ज्वलन्-मुखी ।
गुरुमूर्तिर् गुणनिधिर् गोमाता गुहजन्मभूः ॥ १२१॥
verses.transliteration:
darāndolita-dīrghākṣī dara-hāsojjvalan-mukhī .
gurumūrtir guṇanidhir gomātā guhajanmabhūḥ .. 121..

translations.english: Her long eyes slightly tremble, and Her face shines with a mild smile. She is the embodiment of the Guru, the treasure of virtues, the Mother of cows, and the birthplace of Guha (Kārttikeya).

verses.original:
देवेशी दण्डनीतिस्था दहराकाश-रूपिणी ।
प्रतिपन्मुख्य-राकान्त-तिथि-मण्डल-पूजिता ॥ १२२॥
verses.transliteration:
deveśī daṇḍanītisthā daharākāśa-rūpiṇī .
pratipanmukhya-rākānta-tithi-maṇḍala-pūjitā .. 122..

translations.english: She is the ruler of Devas, established in the science of punishment (Daṇḍanīti), and the form of the inner space (Daharākāśa). She is worshiped by the circle of lunar days (Tithis), from the first day to the full moon.

verses.original:
कलात्मिका कलानाथा काव्यालाप-विनोदिनी ।
सचामर-रमा-वाणी-सव्य-दक्षिण-सेविता ॥ १२३॥
verses.transliteration:
kalātmikā kalānāthā kāvyālāpa-vinodinī .
sacāmara-ramā-vāṇī-savya-dakṣiṇa-sevitā .. 123..

translations.english: She is the soul of arts, the Lord of arts, and delights in poetic conversation. She is served by Ramā (Lakṣmī) and Vāṇī (Sarasvatī) on Her left and right, holding whisks (Cāmaras).

verses.original:
आदिशक्तिर् अमेयाऽऽत्मा परमा पावनाकृतिः ।
अनेककोटि-ब्रह्माण्ड-जननी दिव्यविग्रहा ॥ १२४॥
verses.transliteration:
ādiśaktir ameyā”tmā paramā pāvanākṛtiḥ .
anekakoṭi-brahmāṇḍa-jananī divyavigrahā .. 124..

translations.english: She is the primeval power (Ādiśakti), of immeasurable soul, the supreme, of purifying form. She is the mother of millions of universes, and possesses a divine body.

verses.original:
क्लींकारी केवला गुह्या कैवल्य-पददायिनी ।
त्रिपुरा त्रिजगद्वन्द्या त्रिमूर्तिस् त्रिदशेश्वरी ॥ १२५॥
verses.transliteration:
klīṃkārī kevalā guhyā kaivalya-padadāyinī .
tripurā trijagadvandyā trimūrtis tridaśeśvarī .. 125..

translations.english: She is the sound of the Bīja Mantra 'Klīm', the absolute (Kevalā), the secret one, and the bestower of the state of Kaivalya (liberation). She is Tripurā, worshiped by the three worlds, the three deities (Brahmā, Viṣṇu, Śiva), and the ruler of the thirty Devas.

verses.original:
त्र्यक्षरी दिव्य-गन्धाढ्या सिन्दूर-तिलकाञ्चिता ।
उमा शैलेन्द्रतनया गौरी गन्धर्व-सेविता ॥ १२६॥
verses.transliteration:
tryakṣarī divya-gandhāḍhyā sindūra-tilakāñcitā .
umā śailendratanayā gaurī gandharva-sevitā .. 126..

translations.english: She is the three-lettered mantra, rich with divine fragrance, and adorned with a vermillion mark on Her forehead. She is Umā, the daughter of the King of Mountains, Gaurī, and served by the Gandharvas.

verses.original:
विश्वगर्भा स्वर्णगर्भाऽवरदा वागधीश्वरी ।
ध्यानगम्याऽपरिच्छेद्या ज्ञानदा ज्ञानविग्रहा ॥ १२७॥
verses.transliteration:
viśvagarbhā svarṇagarbhā’varadā vāgadhīśvarī .
dhyānagamyā’paricchedyā jñānadā jñānavigrahā .. 127..

translations.english: She holds the universe in Her womb, has a golden womb, grants boons, and is the ruler of speech. She is attainable through meditation, immeasurable, the bestower of knowledge, and the embodiment of knowledge.

verses.original:
सर्ववेदान्त-संवेद्या सत्यानन्द-स्वरूपिणी ।
लोपामुद्रार्चिता लीला-कॢप्त-ब्रह्माण्ड-मण्डला ॥ १२८॥
verses.transliteration:
sarvavedānta-saṃvedyā satyānanda-svarūpiṇī .
lopāmudrārcitā līlā-kḷpta-brahmāṇḍa-maṇḍalā .. 128..

translations.english: She is known through all Vedāntas, the form of truth and bliss (Saccidānanda). She is worshiped by Lopāmudrā, and created the sphere of the universe through Her mere sport.

verses.original:
अदृश्या दृश्यरहिता विज्ञात्री वेद्यवर्जिता ।
योगिनी योगदा योग्या योगानन्दा युगन्धरा ॥ १२९॥
verses.transliteration:
adṛśyā dṛśyarahitā vijñātrī vedyavarjitā .
yoginī yogadā yogyā yogānandā yugandharā .. 129..

translations.english: She is invisible, devoid of visible objects, the absolute knower, and free from all objects of knowledge. She is the Yoginī, the giver of Yoga, fit for Yoga, the bliss of Yoga, and the supporter of the yoke (of the universe).

verses.original:
इच्छाशक्ति-ज्ञानशक्ति-क्रियाशक्ति-स्वरूपिणी ।
सर्वाधारा सुप्रतिष्ठा सदसद्रूप-धारिणी ॥ १३०॥
verses.transliteration:
icchāśakti-jñānaśakti-kriyāśakti-svarūpiṇī .
sarvādhārā supratiṣṭhā sadasadrūpa-dhāriṇī .. 130..

translations.english: She is the form of the power of will, the power of knowledge, and the power of action. She is the support of all, the most stable, and holds the form of both existence and non-existence.

verses.original:
अष्टमूर्तिर् अजाजैत्री लोकयात्रा-विधायिनी ।
एकाकिनी भूमरूपा निर्द्वैता द्वैतवर्जिता ॥ १३१॥
verses.transliteration:
aṣṭamūrtir ajājaitrī lokayātrā-vidhāyinī .
ekākinī bhūmarūpā nirdvaitā dvaitavarjitā .. 131..

translations.english: She is the eight-fold manifestation (Aṣṭamūrti), unconquered, and the ordainer of the ways of the world. She is the only one (Ekākinī), the form of the Infinite (Bhūmarūpā), non-dual, and free from duality.

verses.original:
अन्नदा वसुदा वृद्धा ब्रह्मात्मैक्य-स्वरूपिणी ।
बृहती ब्राह्मणी ब्राह्मी ब्रह्मानन्दा बलिप्रिया ॥ १३२॥
verses.transliteration:
annadā vasudā vṛddhā brahmātmaikya-svarūpiṇī .
bṛhatī brāhmaṇī brāhmī brahmānandā balipriyā .. 132..

translations.english: She is the giver of food, the bestower of wealth, the ancient one, and the form of the unity of the individual and Supreme Soul. She is vast (Bṛhatī), the feminine of Brāhmaṇa, the power of Brahmā, the bliss of Brahmā, and fond of sacrifices (Bali).

verses.original:
भाषारूपा बृहत्सेना भावाभाव-विवर्जिता ।
सुखाराध्या शुभकरी शोभना सुलभा गतिः ॥ १३३॥
verses.transliteration:
bhāṣārūpā bṛhatsenā bhāvābhāva-vivarjitā .
sukhārādhyā śubhakarī śobhanā sulabhā gatiḥ .. 133..

translations.english: She is the form of language, has a great army, and is free from existence and non-existence. She is easy to worship, performs auspicious deeds, is beautiful, and an easily accessible path (to liberation).

verses.original:
राज-राजेश्वरी राज्य-दायिनी राज्य-वल्लभा ।
राजत्कृपा राजपीठ-निवेशित-निजाश्रिता ॥ १३४॥
verses.transliteration:
rāja-rājeśvarī rājya-dāyinī rājya-vallabhā .
rājatkṛpā rājapīṭha-niveśita-nijāśritā .. 134..

translations.english: She is the ruler of the king of kings (Kubera), the bestower of kingdoms, and the beloved of the kingdom. Her grace shines brightly, and She seats her dependents on the royal throne.

verses.original:
राज्यलक्ष्मीः कोशनाथा चतुरङ्ग-बलेश्वरी ।
साम्राज्य-दायिनी सत्यसन्धा सागरमेखला ॥ १३५॥
verses.transliteration:
rājyalakṣmīḥ kośanāthā caturaṅga-baleśvarī .
sāmrājya-dāyinī satyasandhā sāgaramekhalā .. 135..

translations.english: She is the Lakṣmī of the kingdom, the mistress of the treasury, and the ruler of the four-fold army. She grants imperial sovereignty, is bound by truth, and has the oceans as Her girdle (Earth).

verses.original:
दीक्षिता दैत्यशमनी सर्वलोक-वशङ्करी ।
सर्वार्थदात्री सावित्री सच्चिदानन्द-रूपिणी ॥ १३६॥
verses.transliteration:
dīkṣitā daityaśamanī sarvaloka-vaśaṅkarī .
sarvārthadātrī sāvitrī saccidānanda-rūpiṇī .. 136..

translations.english: She is initiated, the subduer of demons, and brings all worlds under control. She is the giver of all desired objects, Sāvitrī (Gāyatrī), and the form of existence, consciousness, and bliss (Saccidānanda).

verses.original:
देश-कालापरिच्छिन्ना सर्वगा सर्वमोहिनी ।
सरस्वती शास्त्रमयी गुहाम्बा गुह्यरूपिणी ॥ १३७॥
verses.transliteration:
deśa-kālāparicchinnā sarvagā sarvamohinī .
sarasvatī śāstramayī guhāmbā guhyarūpiṇī .. 137..

translations.english: She is not limited by space or time, is all-pervading, and charms everyone. She is Sarasvatī, full of scriptures, the mother of Guha (Kārttikeya), and of secret form.

verses.original:
सर्वोपाधि-विनिर्मुक्ता सदाशिव-पतिव्रता ।
सम्प्रदायेश्वरी साध्वी गुरुमण्डल-रूपिणी ॥ १३८॥
verses.transliteration:
sarvopādhi-vinirmuktā sadāśiva-pativratā .
sampradāyeśvarī sādhvī gurumaṇḍala-rūpiṇī .. 138..

translations.english: She is free from all limiting adjuncts, the chaste wife of Sadāśiva. She is the ruler of the tradition (Sampradāya), virtuous, and the form of the circle of Gurus.

verses.original:
कुलोत्तीर्णा भगाराध्या माया मधुमती मही ।
गणाम्बा गुह्यकाराध्या कोमलाङ्गी गुरुप्रिया ॥ १३९॥
verses.transliteration:
kulottīrṇā bhagārādhyā māyā madhumatī mahī .
gaṇāmbā guhyakārādhyā komalāṅgī gurupriyā .. 139..

translations.english: She is beyond the lineage, worshiped in the Yoni/Bhaga, the illusory power (Māyā), full of honey/nectar (Madhumatī), the Earth (Mahī). She is the mother of Gaṇas, worshiped by the Guhyakas, has tender limbs, and is dear to the Guru.

verses.original:
स्वतन्त्रा सर्वतन्त्रेशी दक्षिणामूर्ति-रूपिणी ।
सनकादि-समाराध्या शिवज्ञान-प्रदायिनी ॥ १४०॥
verses.transliteration:
svatantrā sarvatantreśī dakṣiṇāmūrti-rūpiṇī .
sanakādi-samārādhyā śivajñāna-pradāyinī .. 140..

translations.english: She is independent, the ruler of all Tantras, and the form of Dakṣiṇāmūrti. She is equally worshiped by Sanaka and others, and the bestower of the knowledge of Śiva.

verses.original:
चित्कलाऽऽनन्द-कलिका प्रेमरूपा प्रियङ्करी ।
नामपारायण-प्रीता नन्दिविद्या नटेश्वरी ॥ १४१॥
verses.transliteration:
citkalā”nanda-kalikā premarūpā priyaṅkarī .
nāmapārāyaṇa-prītā nandividyā naṭeśvarī .. 141..

translations.english: She is the spark of consciousness, the bud of bliss, the form of love, and the doer of what is pleasing. She is pleased by the recitation of Her names, the knowledge of Nandī, and the ruler of dancers (Śiva as Naṭarāja).

verses.original:
मिथ्या-जगदधिष्ठाना मुक्तिदा मुक्तिरूपिणी ।
लास्यप्रिया लयकरी लज्जा रम्भादिवन्दिता ॥ १४२॥
verses.transliteration:
mithyā-jagadadhiṣṭhānā muktidā muktirūpiṇī .
lāsyapriyā layakrī lajjā rambhādivanditā .. 142..

translations.english: She is the substratum of the illusory world, the giver of liberation, and the form of liberation itself. She is fond of the graceful dance (Lāsya), the cause of dissolution, modesty (Lajjā), and is worshiped by Rambhā and other celestial dancers.

verses.original:
भवदाव-सुधावृष्टिः पापारण्य-दवानला ।
दौर्भाग्य-तूलवातूला जराध्वान्त-रविप्रभा ॥ १४३॥
verses.transliteration:
bhavadāva-sudhāvṛṣṭiḥ pāpāraṇya-davānalā .
daurbhāgya-tūlavātūlā jarādhvānta-raviprabhā .. 143..

translations.english: She is the shower of nectar on the forest fire of worldly existence, the forest fire to the forest of sins. She is the storm to the cotton-wool of misfortune, and the sunlight to the darkness of old age.

verses.original:
भाग्याब्धि-चन्द्रिका भक्त-चित्तकेकि-घनाघना ।
रोगपर्वत-दम्भोलिर् मृत्युदारु-कुठारिका ॥ १४४॥
verses.transliteration:
bhāgyābdhi-candrikā bhakta-cittakeki-ghanāghanā .
rogaparvata-dambholir mṛtyudāru-kuṭhārikā .. 144..

translations.english: She is the moonlight to the ocean of fortune, the dense cloud to the peacock of the devotee's mind. She is the thunderbolt to the mountain of disease, and the axe to the wood of death.

verses.original:
महेश्वरी महाकाली महाग्रासा महाशना ।
अपर्णा चण्डिका चण्डमुण्डासुर-निषूदिनी ॥ १४५॥
verses.transliteration:
maheśvarī mahākālī mahāgrāsā mahāśanā .
aparṇā caṇḍikā caṇḍamuṇḍāsura-niṣūdinī .. 145..

translations.english: She is the Great Goddess, Mahākālī, the great consumer (of the universe), and the great eater. She is Aparṇā, Caṇḍikā, and the killer of the demon Caṇḍa and Muṇḍa.

verses.original:
क्षराक्षरात्मिका सर्व-लोकेशी विश्वधारिणी ।
त्रिवर्गदात्री सुभगा त्र्यम्बका त्रिगुणात्मिका ॥ १४६॥
verses.transliteration:
kṣarākṣarātmikā sarva-lokeśī viśvadhāriṇī .
trivargadātrī subhagā tryambakā triguṇātmikā .. 146..

translations.english: She is the essence of the perishable and imperishable, the ruler of all worlds, and the supporter of the universe. She is the giver of the three goals (Dharma, Artha, Kāma), auspicious, three-eyed, and the soul of the three qualities (Sattva, Rajas, Tamas).

verses.original:
स्वर्गापवर्गदा शुद्धा जपापुष्प-निभाकृतिः ।
ओजोवती द्युतिधरा यज्ञरूपा प्रियव्रता ॥ १४७॥
verses.transliteration:
svargāpavargadā śuddhā japāpuṣpa-nibhākṛtiḥ .
ojovatī dyutidharā yajñarūpā priyavratā .. 147..

translations.english: She grants heaven and liberation, is pure, and has a form like the Japā flower. She is full of vitality, radiant, the form of sacrifice (Yajña), and is devoted to vows (or fond of devotees).

verses.original:
दुराराध्या दुराधर्षा पाटली-कुसुम-प्रिया ।
महती मेरुनिलया मन्दार-कुसुम-प्रिया ॥ १४८॥
verses.transliteration:
durārādhyā durādharṣā pāṭalī-kusuma-priyā .
mahatī merunilayā mandāra-kusuma-priyā .. 148..

translations.english: She is difficult to worship, difficult to conquer, and fond of the Pāṭalī flower. She is great, resides on Mount Meru, and is fond of the Mandāra flower.

verses.original:
वीराराध्या विराड्रूपा विरजा विश्वतोमुखी ।
प्रत्यग्रूपा पराकाशा प्राणदा प्राणरूपिणी ॥ १४९॥
verses.transliteration:
vīrārādhyā virāḍrūpā virajā viśvatomukhī .
pratyagrūpā parākāśā prāṇadā prāṇarūpiṇī .. 149..

translations.english: She is worshiped by heroes, the cosmic form (Virāḍrūpā), stainless, and facing all directions. She is the inner Self, the supreme ether (Parākāśā), the giver of life, and the form of life itself.

verses.original:
मार्ताण्ड-भैरवाराध्या मन्त्रिणीन्यस्त-राज्यधूः ।
त्रिपुरेशी जयत्सेना निस्त्रैगुण्या परापरा ॥ १५०॥
verses.transliteration:
mārtāṇḍa-bhairavārādhyā mantriṇīnyasta-rājyadhūḥ .
tripureśī jayatsenā nistraiguṇyā parāparā .. 150..

translations.english: She is worshiped by Mārtaṇḍa Bhairava, and has entrusted the burden of the kingdom to the Minister (Mantriṇī). She is the ruler of the three cities, has a victorious army, is beyond the three qualities, and is both transcendent and immanent.

verses.original:
सत्य-ज्ञानानन्द-रूपा सामरस्य-परायणा ।
कपर्दिनी कलामाला कामधुक् कामरूपिणी ॥ १५१॥
verses.transliteration:
satya-jñānānanda-rūpā sāmarasya-parāyaṇā .
kapardinī kalāmālā kāmadhuk kāmarūpiṇī .. 151..

translations.english: She is the form of **Truth, Knowledge, and Bliss** (Satya-Jñāna-Ānanda), deeply devoted to **harmony** (Sāmarasya). She has matted locks (Kapardinī), is a garland of **arts** (Kalāmālā), the **wish-fulfilling cow** (Kāmadhuk), and can assume any **form at will** (Kāmarūpiṇī).

verses.original:
कलानिधिः काव्यकला रसज्ञा रसशेवधिः ।
पुष्टा पुरातना पूज्या पुष्करा पुष्करेक्षणा ॥ १५२॥
verses.transliteration:
kalānidhiḥ kāvyakalā rasajñā rasaśevadhiḥ .
puṣṭā purātanā pūjyā puṣkarā puṣkarekṣaṇā .. 152..

translations.english: She is the **treasury of arts** (Kalānidhiḥ), the **art of poetry** (Kāvyakalā), the **knower of aesthetic delight** (Rasajñā), and the **storehouse of sentiments** (Rasaśevadhiḥ). She is **well-nourished** (Puṣṭā), **ancient** (Purātanā), **adorable** (Pūjyā), the **lotus** (Puṣkarā), and has **lotus-like eyes** (Puṣkarekṣaṇā).

verses.original:
परंज्योतिः परंधाम परमाणुः परात्परा ।
पाशहस्ता पाशहन्त्री परमन्त्र-विभेदिनी ॥ १५३॥
verses.transliteration:
paraṃjyotiḥ paraṃdhāma paramāṇuḥ parātparā .
pāśahastā pāśahantrī paramantra-vibhedinī .. 153..

translations.english: She is the **Supreme Light** (Paraṃjyotiḥ), the **Supreme Abode** (Paraṃdhāma), the **ultimate atom** (Paramāṇuḥ), and **greater than the greatest** (Parātparā). She holds a **noose** (Pāśahastā), the **destroyer of bonds** (Pāśahantrī), and the **splitter of enemy mantras** (Paramantra-Vibhedinī).

verses.original:
मूर्ताऽमूर्ताऽनित्यतृप्ता मुनिमानस-हंसिका ।
सत्यव्रता सत्यरूपा सर्वान्तर्यामिनी सती ॥ १५४॥
verses.transliteration:
mūrtā’mūrtā’nityatṛptā munimānasa-haṃsikā .
satyavratā satyarūpā sarvāntaryāminī satī .. 154..

translations.english: She is with **form** (Mūrtā), **formless** (Amūrtā), **eternally contented** (Nityatṛptā), and the **swan in the mind of sages** (Munimānasa-Haṃsikā). She is committed to **truthful vows** (Satyavratā), the **form of truth** (Satyarūpā), the **inner controller of all** (Sarvāntaryāminī), and the **virtuous woman** (Satī).

verses.original:
ब्रह्माणी ब्रह्मजननी बहुरूपा बुधार्चिता ।
प्रसवित्री प्रचण्डाऽऽज्ञा प्रतिष्ठा प्रकटाकृतिः ॥ १५५॥
verses.transliteration:
brahmāṇī brahmajananī bahurūpā budhārcitā .
prasavitrī pracaṇḍā”jñā pratiṣṭhā prakaṭākṛtiḥ .. 155..

translations.english: She is the **power of Brahmā** (Brahmāṇī), the **mother of Brahmā** (Brahmajananī), has **many forms** (Bahurūpā), and is **worshiped by the wise** (Budhārcitā). She is the **creatress** (Prasavitrī), has a **fierce command** (Pracaṇḍājñā), is the **foundation** (Pratiṣṭhā), and has a **manifested form** (Prakaṭākṛtiḥ).

verses.original:
प्राणेश्वरी प्राणदात्री पञ्चाशत्पीठ-रूपिणी ।
विश‍ृङ्खला विविक्तस्था वीरमाता वियत्प्रसूः ॥ १५६॥
verses.transliteration:
prāṇeśvarī prāṇadātrī pañcāśatpīṭha-rūpiṇī .
viśṛṅkhalā viviktasthā vīramātā viyatprasūḥ .. 156..

translations.english: She is the **ruler of life-force** (Prāṇeśvarī), the **giver of life** (Prāṇadātrī), and the **form of the fifty Pīṭhas** (centres of worship). She is **unfettered** (Viśṛṅkhalā), resides in **solitude** (Viviktasthā), the **mother of heroes** (Vīramātā), and the **source of the sky** (Viyatprasūḥ).

verses.original:
मुकुन्दा मुक्तिनिलया मूलविग्रह-रूपिणी ।
भावज्ञा भवरोगघ्नी भवचक्र-प्रवर्तिनी ॥ १५७॥
verses.transliteration:
mukundā muktinilayā mūlavigraha-rūpiṇī .
bhāvajñā bhavarogaghnī bhavacakra-pravartinī .. 157..

translations.english: She is the **giver of liberation** (Mukundā), the **abode of liberation** (Muktinilayā), and the **form of the original body** (Mūlavigraha-Rūpiṇī). She **knows all feelings** (Bhāvajñā), the **destroyer of the disease of worldly existence** (Bhavarogaghnī), and the **activator of the wheel of transmigration** (Bhavacakra-Pravartinī).

verses.original:
छन्दःसारा शास्त्रसारा मन्त्रसारा तलोदरी ।
उदारकीर्तिर् उद्दामवैभवा वर्णरूपिणी ॥ १५८॥
verses.transliteration:
chandaḥsārā śāstrasārā mantrasārā talodarī .
udārakīrtir uddāmavaibhavā varṇarūpiṇī .. 158..

translations.english: She is the **essence of meters** (Chandaḥsārā), the **essence of scriptures** (Śāstrasārā), the **essence of mantras** (Mantrasārā), and has a **slender waist** (Talodarī). She has **noble fame** (Udārakīrtiḥ), **unrestrained glory** (Uddāmavaibhavā), and the **form of letters** (Varṇarūpiṇī).

verses.original:
जन्ममृत्यु-जरातप्त-जनविश्रान्ति-दायिनी ।
सर्वोपनिष-दुद्-घुष्टा शान्त्यतीत-कलात्मिका ॥ १५९॥
verses.transliteration:
janmamṛtyu-jarātapta-janaviśrānti-dāyinī .
sarvopaniṣa-dud-ghuṣṭā śāntyatīta-kalātmikā .. 159..

translations.english: She grants **rest to those tormented** by birth, death, and old age. She is **proclaimed by all the Upaniṣads** (Sarvopaniṣad-udghuṣṭā), and the **soul of the Tranquil-beyond Art** (Śāntyatīta-Kalātmikā).

verses.original:
गम्भीरा गगनान्तस्था गर्विता गानलोलुपा ।
कल्पना-रहिता काष्ठाऽकान्ता कान्तार्ध-विग्रहा ॥ १६०॥
verses.transliteration:
gambhīrā gaganāntasthā garvitā gānalolupā .
kalpanā-rahitā kāṣṭhā’kāntā kāntārdha-vigrahā .. 160..

translations.english: She is **profound** (Gambhīrā), resides **within the sky** (Gaganāntasthā), **proud** (Garvitā), and **eagerly fond of singing** (Gānalolupā). She is **free from imagination** (Kalpanā-Rahitā), the **final limit** (Kāṣṭhā), **not beloved** (Akāntā, possibly meaning unparalleled), and has **half the body of Her husband** (Kāntārdha-Vigrahā, Ardhanārīśvara form).

verses.original:
कार्यकारण-निर्मुक्ता कामकेलि-तरङ्गिता ।
कनत्कनकता-टङ्का लीला-विग्रह-धारिणी ॥ १६१॥
verses.transliteration:
kāryakāraṇa-nirmuktā kāmakeli-taraṅgitā .
kanatkanakatā-ṭaṅkā līlā-vigraha-dhāriṇī .. 161..

translations.english: She is **free from cause and effect** (Kāryakāraṇa-Nirmuktā), **rippling with the sport of love** (Kāmakeli-Taraṅgitā). She has a **shining golden axe** (Kanatkanakatā-Ṭaṅkā), and holds a **playful divine body** (Līlā-Vigraha-Dhāriṇī).

verses.original:
अजा क्षयविनिर्मुक्ता मुग्धा क्षिप्र-प्रसादिनी ।
अन्तर्मुख-समाराध्या बहिर्मुख-सुदुर्लभा ॥ १६२॥
verses.transliteration:
ajā kṣayavinirmuktā mugdhā kṣipra-prasādinī .
antarmukha-samārādhyā bahirmukha-sudurlabhā .. 162..

translations.english: She is **unborn** (Ajā), **free from decay** (Kṣayavinirmuktā), **charming/innocent** (Mugdhā), and **quickly bestows grace** (Kṣipra-Prasādinī). She is **easily worshipped by the inward-turned mind** (Antarmukha-Samārādhyā), but **very difficult for the outward-turned mind** (Bahirmukha-Sudurlabhā).

verses.original:
त्रयी त्रिवर्गनिलया त्रिस्था त्रिपुरमालिनी ।
निरामया निरालम्बा स्वात्मारामा सुधासृतिः ॥ १६३॥
verses.transliteration:
trayī trivarganilayā tristhā tripuramālinī .
nirāmayā nirālambā svātmārāmā sudhāsṛtiḥ .. 163..

translations.english: She is the **Vedic triad** (Trayī), the **abode of the three goals** (Dharma, Artha, Kāma), resides in the **three states** (waking, dream, deep sleep), and is **Tripuramālinī** (a form of the Goddess). She is **free from disease** (Nirāmayā), **unsupported** (Nirālambā), **rejoicing in Her own Self** (Svātmārāmā), and a **stream of nectar** (Sudhāsṛtiḥ).

verses.original:
संसारपङ्क-निर्मग्न-समुद्धरण-पण्डिता ।
यज्ञप्रिया यज्ञकर्त्री यजमान-स्वरूपिणी ॥ १६४॥
verses.transliteration:
saṃsārapaṅka-nirmagna-samuddharaṇa-paṇḍitā .
yajñapriyā yajñakartrī yajamāna-svarūpiṇī .. 164..

translations.english: She is **skilled in raising up those sunk in the mud of worldly existence** (Saṃsārapaṅka-Nirmagna-Samuddharaṇa-Paṇḍitā). She is **fond of sacrifice** (Yajñapriyā), the **performer of sacrifice** (Yajñakartrī), and the **form of the sacrificer** (Yajamāna-Svarūpiṇī).

verses.original:
धर्माधारा धनाध्यक्षा धनधान्य-विवर्धिनी ।
विप्रप्रिया विप्ररूपा विश्वभ्रमण-कारिणी ॥ १६५॥
verses.transliteration:
dharmādhārā dhanādhyakṣā dhanadhānya-vivardhinī .
viprapriyā viprarūpā viśvabhramaṇa-kāriṇī .. 165..

translations.english: She is the **support of Dharma** (Dharmādhārā), the **superintendent of wealth** (Dhanādhyakṣā), and the **increaser of wealth and grain** (Dhanadhānya-Vivardhinī). She is **dear to Brāhmaṇas** (Viprapriyā), the **form of a Brāhmaṇa** (Viprarūpā), and the **cause of the universe's movement** (Viśvabhramaṇa-Kāriṇī).

verses.original:
विश्वग्रासा विद्रुमाभा वैष्णवी विष्णुरूपिणी ।
अयोनिर् योनिनिलया कूटस्था कुलरूपिणी ॥ १६६॥
verses.transliteration:
viśvagrāsā vidrumābhā vaiṣṇavī viṣṇurūpiṇī .
ayonir yoninilayā kūṭasthā kularūpiṇī .. 166..

translations.english: She **devours the universe** (Viśvagrāsā), has the **lustre of coral** (Vidrumābhā), is the **power of Viṣṇu** (Vaiṣṇavī), and the **form of Viṣṇu** (Viṣṇurūpiṇī). She is **unborn** (Ayoniḥ), the **abode of all births** (Yōninilayā), **immutable** (Kūṭasthā), and the **form of the Kula path** (Kularūpiṇī).

verses.original:
वीरगोष्ठीप्रिया वीरा नैष्कर्म्या नादरूपिणी ।
विज्ञानकलना कल्या विदग्धा बैन्दवासना ॥ १६७॥
verses.transliteration:
vīragoṣṭhīpriyā vīrā naiṣkarmyā nādarūpiṇī .
vijñānakalanā kalyā vidagdhā baindavāsanā .. 167..

translations.english: She is **fond of the assembly of heroes** (Vīragoṣṭhīpriyā), **heroic** (Vīrā), **free from action** (Naiṣkarmyā), and the **form of the primordial sound** (Nādarūpiṇī). She is the **apprehension of special knowledge** (Vijñānakalanā), **expert/auspicious** (Kalyā), **clever** (Vidagdhā), and has **her seat in the Bindu** (Baindavāsanā).

verses.original:
तत्त्वाधिका तत्त्वमयी तत्त्वमर्थ-स्वरूपिणी ।
सामगानप्रिया सौम्या सदाशिव-कुटुम्बिनी ॥ १६८॥
verses.transliteration:
tattvādhikā tattvamayī tattvamartha-svarūpiṇī .
sāmagānapriyā saumyā sadāśiva-kuṭumbinī .. 168..

translations.english: She **transcends the principles** (Tattvādhikā), is **full of the principles** (Tattvamayī), and the **meaning of the great statement 'Tat Tvam Asi'** (Tattvamartha-Svarūpiṇī). She is **fond of Sāma chants** (Sāmagānapriyā), **gentle** (Saumyā), and the **wife of Sadāśiva** (Sadāśiva-Kuṭumbinī).

verses.original:
सव्यापसव्य-मार्गस्था सर्वापद्विनिवारिणी ।
स्वस्था स्वभावमधुरा धीरा धीरसमर्चिता ॥ १६९॥
verses.transliteration:
savyāpasavya-mārgasthā sarvāpadvinivāriṇī .
svasthā svabhāvamadhurā dhīrā dhīrasamarcitā .. 169..

translations.english: She is **established in the right-hand and left-hand paths** (Savyāpasavya-Mārgasthā), and the **remover of all calamities** (Sarvāpadvinivāriṇī). She is **established in the Self** (Svasthā), **naturally sweet** (Svabhāvamadhurā), **courageous** (Dhīrā), and **worshiped by the courageous/steadfast** (Dhīrasamarcitā).

verses.original:
चैतन्यार्घ्य-समाराध्या चैतन्य-कुसुमप्रिया ।
सदोदिता सदातुष्टा तरुणादित्य-पाटला ॥ १७०॥
verses.transliteration:
caitanyārghya-samārādhyā caitanya-kusumapriyā .
sadoditā sadātuṣṭā taruṇāditya-pāṭalā .. 170..

translations.english: She is **worshiped with the offering of Consciousness** (Caitanyārghya-Samārādhyā), and **fond of the flower of Consciousness** (Caitanya-Kusumapriyā). She is **eternally risen** (Sadoditā), **ever contented** (Sadātuṣṭā), and of a **pale red color like the morning sun** (Taruṇāditya-Pāṭalā).

verses.original:
दक्षिणा-दक्षिणाराध्या दरस्मेर-मुखाम्बुजा ।
कौलिनी-केवलाऽनर्घ्य-कैवल्य-पददायिनी ॥ १७१॥
verses.transliteration:
dakṣiṇā-dakṣiṇārādhyā darasmera-mukhāmbujā .
kaulinī-kevalā’narghya-kaivalya-padadāyinī .. 171..

translations.english: She is the **ritual fee/grace** (Dakṣiṇā), **worshiped by the southern (Dakṣiṇa) path** (Dakṣiṇārādhyā), and Her **lotus-face has a slight smile** (Darasmera-Mukhāmbuja). She is the **Kaulinī** (Goddess of the Kula tradition), the **Absolute** (Kevalā), and the **bestower of the invaluable state of Kaivalya** (liberation).

verses.original:
स्तोत्रप्रिया स्तुतिमती श्रुति-संस्तुत-वैभवा ।
मनस्विनी मानवती महेशी मङ्गलाकृतिः ॥ १७२॥
verses.transliteration:
stotrapriyā stutimatī śruti-saṃstuta-vaibhavā .
manasvinī mānavatī maheśī maṅgalākṛtiḥ .. 172..

translations.english: She is **fond of hymns** (Stotrapriyā), **praised** (Stutimatī), and Her **glory is extolled by the Vedas** (Śruti-Saṃstuta-Vaibhavā). She is **high-minded** (Manasvinī), **honorable** (Mānavatī), the **Great Goddess** (Maheśī), and of **auspicious form** (Maṅgalākṛtiḥ).

verses.original:
विश्वमाता जगद्धात्री विशालाक्षी विरागिणी ।
प्रगल्भा परमोदारा परामोदा मनोमयी ॥ १७३॥
verses.transliteration:
viśvamātā jagaddhātrī viśālākṣī virāgiṇī .
pragalbhā paramodārā parāmodā manomayī .. 173..

translations.english: She is the **Mother of the Universe** (Viśvamātā), the **supporter of the world** (Jagaddhātrī), has **large eyes** (Viśālākṣī), and is **dispassionate** (Virāgiṇī). She is **bold/competent** (Pragalbhā), **supremely generous** (Paramodārā), **supreme joy** (Parāmodā), and **consisting of mind** (Manomayī).

verses.original:
व्योमकेशी विमानस्था वज्रिणी वामकेश्वरी ।
पञ्चयज्ञ-प्रिया पञ्च-प्रेत-मञ्चाधिशायिनी ॥ १७४॥
verses.transliteration:
vyomakeśī vimānasthā vajriṇī vāmakeśvarī .
pañcayajña-priyā pañca-preta-mañcādhiśāyinī .. 174..

translations.english: She has **hair like the sky** (Vyomakeśī), **resides in a celestial car** (Vimānasthā), is the **holder of the thunderbolt** (Vajriṇī), and the **Goddess of the Vāmā course** (Vāmakeśvarī). She is **fond of the five great sacrifices** (Pañcayajña-Priyā), and **reclines on a couch made of the five corpses** (Pañca-Preta-Mañcādhiśāyinī).

verses.original:
पञ्चमी पञ्चभूतेशी पञ्च-संख्योपचारिणी ।
शाश्वती शाश्वतैश्वर्या शर्मदा शम्भुमोहिनी ॥ १७५॥
verses.transliteration:
pañcamī pañcabhūteśī pañca-saṃkhyopacāriṇī .
śāśvatī śāśvataiśvaryā śarmadā śambhumohinī .. 175..
