translations.english: She is the **fifth Tithi** (Pañcamī), the **ruler of the five elements** (Pañcabhūteśī), performs **worship with five offerings** (Pañca-Saṃkhyopacāriṇī). She is **eternal** (Śāśvatī), has **everlasting prosperity** (Śāśvataiśvaryā), the **giver of happiness** (Śarmadā), and **bewilders Śambhu** (Śambhumohinī).

verses.original:
धरा धरसुता धन्या धर्मिणी धर्मवर्धिनी ।
लोकातीता गुणातीता सर्वातीता शमात्मिका ॥ १७६॥
verses.transliteration:
dharā dharasutā dhanyā dharmiṇī dharmavardhinī .
lokātītā guṇātītā sarvātītā śamātmikā .. 176..

translations.english: She is the **Earth** (Dharā), the **daughter of the mountain** (Dharasutā), **blessed** (Dhanyā), **virtuous** (Dharmiṇī), and the **increaser of Dharma** (Dharmavardhinī). She **transcends the worlds** (Lokātītā), **transcends the qualities** (Guṇātītā), **transcends everything** (Sarvātītā), and is the **soul of tranquility** (Śamātmikā).

verses.original:
बन्धूक-कुसुमप्रख्या बाला लीलाविनोदिनी ।
सुमङ्गली सुखकरी सुवेषाढ्या सुवासिनी ॥ १७७॥
verses.transliteration:
bandhūka-kusumaprakhyā bālā līlāvinodinī .
sumaṅgalī sukhakarī suveṣāḍhyā suvāsinī .. 177..

translations.english: She has the **lustre of a Bandhūka flower** (Bandhūka-Kusumaprakhyā), is a **young girl** (Bālā), and **delights in sport** (Līlāvinodinī). She is **very auspicious** (Sumaṅgalī), the **giver of happiness** (Sukhakarī), **rich in good dress** (Suveṣāḍhyā), and a **blessed married woman** (Suvāsinī).

verses.original:
सुवासिन्यर्चन-प्रीताऽऽशोभना शुद्धमानसा ।
बिन्दु-तर्पण-सन्तुष्टा पूर्वजा त्रिपुराम्बिका ॥ १७८॥
verses.transliteration:
suvāsinyarcana-prītā”śobhanā śuddhamānasā .
bindu-tarpaṇa-santuṣṭā pūrvajā tripurāmbikā .. 178..

translations.english: She is **pleased by the worship of married women** (Suvāsinyarcana-Prītā), **shining** (Śobhanā), and has a **pure mind** (Śuddhamānasā). She is **contented by the water offering in the Bindu** (Bindu-Tarpaṇa-Santuṣṭā), the **ancient one** (Pūrvajā), and the **Mother of the three cities** (Tripurāmbikā).

verses.original:
दशमुद्रा-समाराध्या त्रिपुराश्री-वशङ्करी ।
ज्ञानमुद्रा ज्ञानगम्या ज्ञानज्ञेय-स्वरूपिणी ॥ १७९॥
verses.transliteration:
daśamudrā-samārādhyā tripurāśrī-vaśaṅkarī .
jñānamudrā jñānagamyā jñānajñeya-svarūpiṇī .. 179..

translations.english: She is **worshiped with the ten Mudrās** (Daśamudrā-Samārādhyā), and **brings the wealth of Tripurā under control** (Tripurāśrī-Vaśaṅkarī). She is the **knowledge gesture** (Jñānamudrā), **attainable by knowledge** (Jñānagamyā), and the **form of the knower and the knowable** (Jñānajñeya-Svarūpiṇī).

verses.original:
योनिमुद्रा त्रिखण्डेशी त्रिगुणाम्बा त्रिकोणगा ।
अनघाऽद्भुत-चारित्रा वाञ्छितार्थ-प्रदायिनी ॥ १८०॥
verses.transliteration:
yonimudrā trikhaṇḍeśī triguṇāmbā trikoṇagā .
anaghā’dbhuta-cāritrā vāñchitārtha-pradāyinī .. 180..

translations.english: She is the **Yoni Mudrā** (Yonimudrā), the **ruler of the three divisions** (Trikhaṇḍeśī), the **Mother of the three qualities** (Triguṇāmbā), and **resides in the triangle** (Trikoṇagā). She is **sinless** (Anaghā), of **wonderful deeds** (Adbhuta-Cāritrā), and the **bestower of desired objects** (Vāñchitārtha-Pradāyinī).

verses.original:
अभ्यासातिशय-ज्ञाता षडध्वातीत-रूपिणी ।
अव्याज-करुणा-मूर्तिर् अज्ञान-ध्वान्त-दीपिका ॥ १८१॥
verses.transliteration:
abhyāsātiśaya-jñātā ṣaḍadhvātīta-rūpiṇī .
avyāja-karuṇā-mūrtir ajñāna-dhvānta-dīpikā .. 181..

translations.english: She is **known through excessive practice** (Abhyāsātiśaya-Jñātā), and the **form transcending the six paths** (of Śaivism). She is the **embodiment of unconditional compassion** (Avyāja-Karuṇā-Mūrtiḥ), and the **lamp in the darkness of ignorance** (Ajñāna-Dhvānta-Dīpikā).

verses.original:
आबाल-गोप-विदिता सर्वानुल्लङ्घ्य-शासना ।
श्रीचक्रराज-निलया श्रीमत्-त्रिपुरसुन्दरी ॥ १८२॥
verses.transliteration:
ābāla-gopa-viditā sarvānullaṅghya-śāsanā .
śrīcakrarāja-nilayā śrīmat-tripurasundarī .. 182..

translations.english: She is **known to all from children to cowherds** (Ābāla-Gopa-Viditā), and Her **command cannot be transgressed by anyone** (Sarvānullaṅghya-Śāsanā). She **resides in the king of wheels, the Śrī Cakra** (Śrīcakrarāja-Nilayā), and is the **illustrious Tripurasundarī**.

verses.original:
श्रीशिवा शिव-शक्त्यैक्य-रूपिणी ललिताम्बिका ।
एवं श्रीललिता देव्या नाम्नां साहस्रकं जगुः ॥
॥ इति श्रीब्रह्माण्डपुराणे उत्तरखण्डे श्रीहयग्रीवागस्त्यसंवादे
श्रीललिता सहस्रनाम स्तोत्र कथनं सम्पूर्णम् ॥
verses.transliteration:
śrīśivā śiva-śaktyaikya-rūpiṇī lalitāmbikā .
evaṃ śrīlalitā devyā nāmnāṃ sāhasrakaṃ jaguḥ ..
.. iti śrībrahmāṇḍapurāṇe uttarakhaṇḍe śrīhayagrīvāgastyasaṃvāde
śrīlalitā sahasranāma stotra kathanaṃ sampūrṇam ..

translations.english:
She is the **Auspicious Śivā**, the **form of the union of Śiva and Śakti** (Śiva-Śaktyaikya-Rūpiṇī), and **Lalitāmbikā** (The Divine Mother Lalitā).
Thus, the **thousand names of the Goddess Śrī Lalitā** have been recited.
**Thus ends the recitation of the Śrī Lalitā Sahasranāma Stotra in the conversation between Śrī Hayagrīva and Agastya, in the Uttarakhanda of the Brahmāṇḍa Purāṇa.**
